events.name: Edge Business Networking Breakfast
events.summary: By attending our business networking breakfasts you will have an opportunity to meet and network with group members who have a very high cal
events.description_html:
By attending our business networking breakfasts you will have an opportunity to meet and network with group members who have a very high calibre of contacts and potential referral partners for you.

 A sample of some of the people you will meet includes:-

  • A branding director whose current / past clients include NSW Health, Westpac, NSW Treasury and more;
  • A business advisor who is a Start Up Australia ambassador and has a very high level of success in building, growing and selling businesses - both his own and other people's.
  • An IT specialist who performed global IT support for Virgin management senior execs on Richard Branson’s boat as well as assisting with IT for Kylie Kwong and Luke Mangan.
  • A bookkeeping agency Director whose current and past clients include Rachel Ruddick, One Teaspoon, FBI Fashion College, MaxMara, Matt Church and Fast Ed
  • An executive coach with contacts at BMW, Fox Sports, Ernst & Young and UTS
  • A natural health and fertility expert whose clients include ‘hatted’ chefs and well known actors

 and many others with amazing networks and contacts that they can introduce you to.

 

Please book in quickly as we only have a limited number of visitor spots available and they will go fast.

BNI - Business Network International is a business and professional networking organization whose primary purpose is to exchange qualified business referrals. It is the largest networking organisation of its kind. Currently, BNI has over 6400 chapters internationally. Last year, members of BNI passed 7 million referrals, which generated $3.2 Billion worth of business for each other.

 What makes BNI unique is that it allows only one person per classification to join a chapter.  Thus, once you have joined, none of your competitors can participate.

Remember to bring plenty of business cards to pass around, as you will meet lots of local business professionals.

events.name: Having Difficult Conversations
events.summary: What makes some conversations difficult? Why do we sometimes hesitate at the thought of having conversations we think of as difficult? How c
events.description_html:
What makes some conversations difficult? Why do we sometimes hesitate at the thought of having conversations we think of as difficult? How can we overcome this and feel more comfortable in having a difficult conversation?

As part of our spotlight on Displays Respect, this three-hour workshop is for UNSW staff looking to build their confidence in approaching and having a difficult conversation respectfully. Through reflection and exploration, participants will uncover the things that help and hinder success, setting you up to have a difficult conversation in a respectful and effective way.

We will cover the key foundations for challenging conversations, how to best prepare for a conversation, understanding the effect of emotional states during the conversation and ways to ensure the conversation stays on track.

You’ll have the opportunity to explore and practice some strategies and will develop a conversation plan to apply in an upcoming difficult conversation.

Please note that this is for UNSW staff only (fixed term and continuing).

events.name: UNSW Early Years Tour—Tigger's Honeypot
events.summary: Visit Tigger's Honeypot—The central playground is surrounded by vast grassy lawns and a gardens to explore. Children feed and care for our r
events.description_html: Visit Tigger's Honeypot—The central playground is surrounded by vast grassy lawns and a gardens to explore. Children feed and care for our resident chickens as well as plant and harvest their own produce in our blossoming vegetable patches. All planned to develop understandings, appreciation and connections to our natural environment and local cultures. Children visit their older friends at the aged facility Milford House to paint, sculpt, sing, laugh and share stories. Our four rooms offer children time to interact in separate age groups for specifically targeted learning experiences. As well, educators plan opportunities with mixed age groups so the children can learn from each other.

events.name: Are you having trouble controlling the way you eat?
events.organiser: by Food Addicts in Recovery Anonymous (FA)
events.summary: Food Addicts in Recovery Anonymous (FA) is a free Twelve Step recovery program for anyone suffering from food obsession, overeating, unde
events.description_html:
Food Addicts in Recovery Anonymous (FA) is a free Twelve Step recovery program for anyone suffering from food obsession, overeating, under-eating or bulimia. Meetings are held Fridays at Salvation Army Welfare Centre, 100 Boyce Road, Maroubra at 10:00am. For more information or a list of additional meetings throughout Australia and the world, visit: www.foodaddicts.org.


ABOUT FOOD ADDICTS IN RECOVERY ANONYMOUS

Food Addicts in Recovery Anonymous is a 12 Step fellowship based on the principles of Alcoholics Anonymous (AA). FA is a tax-exempt, non-profit Twelve Step program that helps people of all ages who have issues with food. There are no dues or fees for members. Anyone, from any walk of life, who seeks recovery from their problems with food, is welcome. 


The following meeting is held in Sydney every week:

Fridays - 10:00 am - 11:30 am

Salvation Army Welfare Centre

100 Boyce Road, Maroubra, NSW 2035

events.name: Data transfer and Research Data Storage (RDS) for HPC
events.organiser: Sydney Informatics Hub, Core Research Facilities, DVCR, The University of Sydney
events.summary:
Sydney Informatics Hub Research Computing Training Series
Zoom link will be provided.

Data transfer and Research Data Storage (RDS) for HPC
events.description_html:
Sydney Informatics Hub Research Computing Training Series

Zoom link will be provided.


Data transfer and Research Data Storage (RDS) for HPC

Please note: OWN LAPTOP REQUIRED with a terminal client installed.

Essential pre-requisites: Competency on the Unix/Linux command line. If you are interested in learning HPC but have no Unix/Linux command-line skills, you MUST first take an 'Introduction to Unix/Linux' course. These are scheduled regularly on campus.

Synopsis: Learn to navigate and interact with the University of Sydney's Research Data Storage options. Learn how to transfer data between your local computer, an external source, the Research Data Store (RDS) and the Artemis High Performance Computer (HPC). Learn how to back up HPC output onto the RDS. 

Target audience: Students and staff who would like to learn how to run compute jobs on Artemis HPC. Participants must have a valid USYD unikey.

Follow-on courses: This course is designed as a 2-part session, with 'Introduction to the Artemis HPC' in the morning and 'Data transfer and RDS for HPC' in the afternoon. IT IS RECOMMENDED TO REGISTER FOR BOTH.

Course notes and additional courses: https://sydney-informatics-hub.github.io/training.artemis/

For more information: Email sih.training@sydney.edu.au 

Sign up for email alerts about training: https://mailman.sydney.edu.au/mailman/listinfo/computing_training

LAC DROP IN SESSION

 

Fortnightly drop in sessions for any NDIS or community support needs.

  • Do you require assistance with Access to the NDIS?

events.name: Managing The Cyber Risks Of Remote Work [WEBINAR]
events.summary: Working remotely has meant we’ve had to rethink our approach to collaboration, productivity and delivering products and services — but what
events.description_html:
Working remotely has meant we’ve had to rethink our approach to collaboration, productivity and delivering products and services — but what about our security? Last week, news broke that Zoom is facing a huge privacy and security backlash as experts warn the video calling software isn’t secure enough. Meanwhile, we’ve recently seen an alarming surge in cyberattacks that allow hackers to steal sensitive data. 

Many of us are now more vulnerable to cyberattacks working from home, which is why we’ve partnered with AustCyber and Cynch Security to bring you a virtual panel on all things cybersecurity. Tune in to our webinar to learn what you can do to secure your digital footprint and protect your team from unknown cyber threats.


OUR SPEAKERS

Michelle Price, CEO of AustCyber 

Michelle is helping the Australian economy to grow through the development of a vibrant domestic cyber security sector, which is also supporting businesses to become more cyber resilient.  She has a background that spans the food industry, risk and governance and policy development – and has worked across government, academia and the private sector.

Adam Selwood, CTO and Co-Founder of Cynch Security

Extensively experienced in solving technology and cybersecurity problems, Adam is passionate about using his expertise to help smaller businesses that have nowhere else to turn. Prior to founding Cynch Security, Adam led Cyber Resilience initiatives within Australia Post.


OUR MODERATOR 

Sally Ann Williams, CEO of Cicada Innovations

events.description_html:
Are you a busy mum wanting simple natural solutions to your everyday problems?

Gain the confidence and tools to create a healthier, happier home for your whole family.

Learn simple tips on how to manage everyday ailments, detox your home and support your emotional and physical wellbeing by including essential oils in your daily routine. 

Essential oils are SO much more than a beautiful smell. They are safe, effective remedies that have the power to transform every aspect of your life. Having these tools at home also saves you time, money and hassle! 

Join me to learn how to use oils for the whole family:

- More restful Sleep

- More energy and focus

- Managing stress and enhancing mood and emotional wellbeing

- Digestion and gut health

- Immune support, coughs and colds

- Better self care

- Weight, sugar cravings and metabolism

- Respiratory Support

- Muscle & Sports Recovery

- Promoting youthful skin and soothing skin irritations 

- Natural, chemical free cleaning

- Cooking

- Natural perfume 

$15 including an essential oil and guide to take home. Location will be provided by email upon booking. 

Tickets must be booked early to be guaranteed a spot - ONLY 7 SPOTS available.

Bring a friend and get empowered on how to enhance your wellbeing naturally!

Can't make the date? Email hello@thenaturalswitch.com.au for an online class to watch at a convenient time or to book a personal consult. 

Keywords: doTERRA, essential oils, natural remedies, holistic health, healthy families, healthy kids, health, wellness, plant medicine, chemical free living, eco friendly, low tox

events.name: Business legal basics
events.summary: Understand the key legal issues associated with setting up and running a business. You will explore which legal structure is best for you,
events.description_html:
Understand the key legal issues associated with setting up and running a business. You will explore which legal structure is best for you, managing the legal issues in your business, what is intellectual property and how it makes your business valuable, and quick tips on legal issues to avoid.

Learning outcomes:

  • Better understand structural issues and governance. 
  • Learn how to separate the individual from the company. 
  • Understand intellectual property.

 

This workshop will be delivered online via Zoom. You will receive the link 48 hours prior to the workshop’s start time.

 


For ACU students

Did you know this workshop can count towards your ACU Leadership Program Certificate? More information about the Leading With Impact Program can be found here:

https://www.studentportal.acu.edu.au/discoveru/community/student-leadership-opportunities/leadership-program--leading-with-impact/leadership-framework

More information about the specific Tier 1 Bronze level activities offered by ACU Collaborate Plus is available at the following link:

https://www.studentportal.acu.edu.au/acuinfo/cao/collaborate-plus


About the presenter



Mike Pym is the CEO of Gordian Lawyers, a law firm specialising in technology law, commercial law, privacy and start ups. Mike has been practising IT law for more than 30 years.

Prior to establishing Gordian Lawyers in 2006, Mike was Head of the Technology Group at one of the largest Australian law firms, and before that he had a number of roles as senior in-house counsel for global IT companies in Europe and Australia.

Mike’s clients include global ICT companies, ASX listed companies, as well as start ups, IT SMEs, Universities and Government Agencies.

Mike is deeply involved in the peak national IT industry association in Australia, the Australian Information Industry Association, where he was elected a Director of the National Board 2012-2018, and was elected to be Deputy Chair of the National Board during 2016-2018.


About the program

The Launch Plus Incubator Program is a series of workshops hosted by ACU Collaborate Plus, Australian Catholic University’s entrepreneurship and innovation hub.

The series is designed to take you on a journey through the key stages of starting a business, or simply further your entrepreneurial skills to take advantage of future opportunities. Attend the full program for maximum benefits or choose specific workshops relevant to you and your aspirations.

Workshop topics include: 

  • design thinking
  • developing and testing your business idea
  • identifying your target market
  • strting a side-hustle in a recession
  • business legal basics
  • digital marketing
  • setting up an online store.

Find event details for all workshops.



                                  Supported by the NSW Government Boosting Business Innovation Program.

events.name: International Freight and Logistics update: ports, planes & airfreight assistance package
events.summary: As a valued stakeholder you are invited to participate in an “International Freight and Logistics update: Ports, Planes & Airfreight assista
events.description_html:
As a valued stakeholder you are invited to participate in an “International Freight and Logistics update: Ports, Planes & Airfreight assistance package” briefing on Wednesday, 22 April 2020 from 3:00pm to 4:00pm (AEDT). The briefing will focus on impacts to Australian businesses engaged in global trade and supply-chains (export and import) resulting from the current global situation. There will also be an update on the Federal Government’s international freight support measures.

 

International Freight Assistance Mechanism

 

On 1 April 2020 the Australian Government announced the $110 million International Freight Assistance Mechanism (IFAM) to help restore critical global supply chains for premium Australian agricultural and fisheries producers, who have been heavily impacted by COVID-19 containment measures around the world.

 

Under the IFAM, planes will take off from key Australian ports with a focus on those locations to enable access to regional and rural Australia and deliver to key global markets such as China, Japan, Hong Kong, Singapore and UAE carrying premium Australian seafood, red meat, dairy and fruit and vegetables.

 

On return, these flights will bring back medical supplies, medicines and equipment to Australia to support our response to COVID-19.

 

Read the Air freight fact sheet to find out more.

 

The briefing will cover:

 

  • MC Wayne Murphy, Senior Export Adviser, NSW Treasury
  • Welcome by Peter Mackey, Director International Trade, NSW Treasury
  • Freight and Logistics update by
    • Marika Calfas, CEO, NSW Ports
    • Brian Lovell, CEO, Australian Federation of International Forwarders (AFIF)
    • Austrade representative
  • Moderated online Q&A session

 

Who should attend?

 

  • NSW businesses engaged in international trade and supply-chains

 

How to register?

 

  • Cost: Free (places are limited) and registration is required. Please use the Eventbrite registration link above. 
  • When: Wednesday, 22 April 2020 from 03:00-04:00pm (AEDT). 
  • Platform: Online (Skype - audio only: Skype dial-in details will be sent to registered attendees on 22 April morning)
  • Further information: +61 438 404 827, tania.panagoda@treasury.nsw.gov.au

 

Read Austrade’s COVID-19 updates for exporters for further information on the current situation. 

 

Privacy:  where you provide any personal information to the Department, you warrant that you have obtained all required consents from relevant persons for such disclosure, in compliance with the Privacy and Personal Information Protection Act 1998.

events.name: Agile Business Analyst (ABA) - Virtual Training, 24 April 2020 (AxisAgile)
events.summary:
To find out more about our company, view AxisAgile's Web Page
 
The role of Business Analyst (BA) changes in the Agile world.  Stay ahead
events.description_html:
To find out more about our company, view AxisAgile's Web Page

 

The role of Business Analyst (BA) changes in the Agile world.  Stay ahead with new techniqus, tools and tactics to guide your Agile team and support your Product Owner.

Our Agile BA course is an engaging 1-day session designed to provide Business Analysts with the knowledge and techniques to optimise the delivery of requirements, ensure that teams build relevant products and assist Product Owners manage the demands of complex initiatives.

Based on the Agile Extension to the BABOK guide, this course builds its foundation on the industry's best practices.

 

Our virtual course (laptop or desktop with Internet connection required) includes:

  • downloadable training materials;
  • real-time instruction; relatable examples;
  • AND the option to attend the same training course in-person at a later date at no additional cost

 

 

What is included in each course?

 

A copy of Scrum Shortcuts Without Cutting Corners

When attending our in-person session, you get a copy of Scrum Shortcuts Without Cutting Corners, the hugely popular book that was selected to be part of the 'Mike Cohn Agile Signature Series' (the premiere book series on Scrum and Agile globally). This book is full of great Agile tactics, tips and tricks that many have found to be invaluable. But don't take our word for it, check out the reviews on Amazon! 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

We're here to support you!

Don't worry, when you've concluded your training with us, we're still here to help via our free ongoing support. Email us with a question and we're sure to reply. 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

USB pen with all electronic materials for each attendee

USB pens with the electronic course materials will be provided at the in-person session to help your team members focus on their training and re-enforce their knowledge after the course.

 


 


 

 

 

 

Workbooks to help you connect with the course

As well as an electronic copy of all of the slides and other materials, on the day of the in-person course you will receive a fill-in-the-gaps, workbook to use and follow along with during the course. This has been specifically designed to help reinforce key learnings.


 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

A sleek laptop case to keep it all together

Not only do we provide you with a whole host of great merchandise, but at the in-person course, we also ensure that you have an efficient way to take it all home with you via the neat laptop bag that you will also receive. You’re welcome!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

This course covers 

  • Traditional vs Agile requirement analysis - Learn how the role of the Business Analyst changes
  • Agile Extension to the BABOK guide - Understand the three horizons and seven principles
  • User Story Mapping - See the whole, while gathering detail on what is most important
  • Where Business Analysts fit in - Understand how a BA fits within a cross-functional delivery team
  • Refining requirements collaboratively - Empathise with the customer, and observe requirements through their eyes
  • Product Backlog - Establishing a sequential delivery order to maximise value delivered
  • Product Backlog Refinement - Understand iterative and incremental analysis
  • Definition of Ready (DoR) - Control the quality of requirements
  • User Stories and User Story Splitting - Utilise the most popular Agile requirement format
  • Behaviour Driven Development (BDD) - Understand how concrete examples can drive out assumptions and ambiguity
  • Job Stories - Understand your customers’ motivations and deliver a result that delights them
  • Fully-dressed and casual use-cases - Use-cases are a valid alternative to User Stories when applied correctly on an Agile project
  • Non-functional requirements - How to include non-functional requirements as part of the Product Backlog and/or Definition of Done (DoD)
  • Kanban - Track BA activities, and optimise the flow of requirements
  • Sprint operations - Deal with changing requirements, disruptive stakeholders, and teams that ask for unecessary detail


 


Private ABA Course

Please contact us to discuss options for in-house, private ABA courses. 

 


Who Should Attend

Business Analysts, Business Architects, Requirements Engineers, Systems Analysts, Process Analysts or anyone involved on an Agile team interested in learning how the role of Business Analyst fits within the Scrum framework will all benefit from this course.

 

 

Group Bookings and Invoices

We also offer discounts for group bookings and invoicing as a method of payment. For more information please contact us now.


  

Refund, Replacement and Postponement Policy

If you have booked onto a course and aren't able to make your course date please refer to our Refund, Replacement and Postponement Policy

events.name: Power BI Intermediate - Online Training - Sydney - 22 April 2020
events.summary:
Learn from the experts in Power BI
Agile Analytics training offers you the opportunity to get hands-on Power BI training from experts. Our t
events.description_html:
Learn from the experts in Power BI

Agile Analytics training offers you the opportunity to get hands-on Power BI training from experts. Our trainers are interactive and draw on their experience to provide real-life scenarios that relate to the written materials.

We can solve your real-world problems during the class because we teach what we do in the field every day.

What will I learn?
This workshop is designed to take your Power BI expertise to the next level with comprehensive training in Tabular modelling, DAX and data visualisation. All you have to do is bring your laptop and we will supply the rest!

Topics:

  • Reports and Dashboards new features and best practices
  • Data modelling and DAX
  • Import, Direct Query, Live, and Composite mode
  • Row-level Security (RLS), static and dynamic options
  • Workspace and App best practices
  • Deployment options
  • Tips on Advanced Analytics using R & Python
  • Group project using your own data

What previous Trainees have said about their experience:

  • “I was concerned was that the trainer would just be reciting/presenting a straight textbook training course with no real knowledge of the material. You definitely proved to have practical and proven expertise in this space though”. – BI Manager, Retail Industry
  • “I was afraid that it may fall into the standard vanilla instructor reading off notes at the front of the room for two days. It was not – Informative, engaging, relevant.” – BI Developer –  NSW Government

 

  • “The course was really good, I got a lot out of it. The trainer was great at explaining everything and answering our questions. The examples we worked through were helpful. It gave us a greater insight into the tools available in Power BI and how we can use it to suit our business needs.” – Data Analyst – Qantas

Agile Analytics urges you to bring your laptop. Alternatively, you can contact us to organise a laptop for you (extra fee applies).

events.name: Introduction to the Artemis HPC
events.organiser: Sydney Informatics Hub, Core Research Facilities, DVCR, The University of Sydney
events.summary:
Sydney Informatics Hub Research Computing Training Series


Zoom link to be provided.

Introduction to the Artemis High Performance Computer
events.description_html:
Sydney Informatics Hub Research Computing Training Series


Zoom link to be provided.


Introduction to the Artemis High Performance Computer (HPC)

Please note: OWN LAPTOP REQUIRED with a terminal client installed.

Essential pre-requisites: Competency on the Unix/Linux command line. If you are interested in learning HPC but have no Unix/Linux command-line skills, you MUST first take an 'Introduction to Unix/Linux' course. These are scheduled regularly on campus.

Synopsis: Learn about the University of Sydney’s HPC ‘Artemis’, including directory structure, software, and how to submit and monitor compute jobs using the PBS Pro scheduling software. Also learn about the national HPC facilities and cloud services available.  Artemis is available at no cost to University of Sydney staff and students.

Target audience: Students and staff who would like to learn how to run compute jobs on Artemis HPC. Participants must have a valid USYD unikey.

Follow-on courses: This course is designed as a 2-part session, with 'Introduction to the Artemis HPC' in the morning and 'Data transfer and RDS for HPC' in the afternoon. IT IS RECOMMENDED TO REGISTER FOR BOTH.

Course notes and additional courses: https://sydney-informatics-hub.github.io/training.artemis/

For more information: Email sih.training@sydney.edu.au 

Sign up for email alerts about training: https://mailman.sydney.edu.au/mailman/listinfo/computing_training

events.summary:
FREQUESNTLY ASKED QUESTIONS
Are there ID or minimum age requirements to enter the event?
Yes, each participant must be 18 years or older at
events.description_html:
FREQUESNTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

Are there ID or minimum age requirements to enter the event?

Yes, each participant must be 18 years or older at the time of completing the course and must present proof of their medical background on their training day.

What are my transport/parking options for getting to and from the event?

There is ample street parkiing avilable within the vicinity of the venue. The venue is located within walking distance of public transport.

What can I bring into the event?

Please bring a pen. A detailed manual and all materials and equipment are supplied.

What's the refund policy?

A full refund will be offered up to 30 days prior to your course date.

Do I have to bring my printed ticket to the event?

Yes, please bring a printed copy of your ticket on your course day.

Is my registration fee or ticket transferrable?

You are able to transfer your enrolment for a fee up to 7 days prior to your course date.

Is it ok if the name on my ticket or registration doesn't match the person who attends?

No, the person listed on the ticket must be the participant in training on the course day.

Can I update my registration information?

Please email us at: pathologyfoundation@gmail.com to update your registration information. 

How can I contact the organiser with any questions?

Email us at: pathologyfoundation@gmail.com or phone us on: 0418103565

events.name: UNSW Founders Information Session
events.summary: Thanks for your interest in UNSW Founders, Australia’s most comprehensive university entrepreneurship program. Our coaching services and pre
events.description_html:
Thanks for your interest in UNSW Founders, Australia’s most comprehensive university entrepreneurship program. Our coaching services and pre-accelerator and accelerator programs are free and accessible to UNSW students, academic staff and Alumni – for life!

These information sessions run online from 12-1pm. You will be emailed the zoom meeting link 24 hours prior to the session (please check your junk folder if you have not received).

Please download the zoom software prior to the meeting time: https://unsw.zoom.us/

This is a great opportunity for you to connect with our startup coaches, fellow entrepreneurs and kick off your journey with UNSW Founders. 

Agenda:

1. Completing the UNSW Founders intake form

2. Who’s in the virtual room

3. UNSW Founders programs and services

4. Matching you with a coach

5. Q&A

Unfortunately, some elements of the UNSW Founders programs and services are not available to professional staff, unless you are also UNSW alumni.

Terms and Conditions apply.

PRIVACY STATEMENT

UNSW is collecting your personal information in this form for the purpose of providing you with more information about the UNSW Founders Program. UNSW is using a third party (Microsoft) to provide the technology platform for this registration form on behalf of UNSW. As a result, any personal information you provide in this form will be processed by Microsoft. Information collected by the University through this form may be processed outside of New South Wales and Australia. The supply of personal information is voluntary. You can request access to and amendment of information we hold about you by contacting founders@unsw.edu.au. The privacy and confidentiality of the personal information held about you will be respected. Personal information collected by UNSW is managed in accordance with its Privacy Management Plan.

By registering for this event/workshop you grant UNSW Founders full rights to use the images from any photography/video footage for publicity and education purposes. This may include (but is not limited to), the right to use them in their printed and online publicity, coursework presentations, social media and press releases. If you do not wish to be photographed please inform an event organiser.

events.name: Little Scientists STEM Acoustics Workshop, Erskineville NSW
events.summary:
Fizzle, crackle, crash, boom, bang; delve into the world of everyday sounds.


Explore the presence and absence of sound, create your own so
events.description_html:
Fizzle, crackle, crash, boom, bang; delve into the world of everyday sounds.


Explore the presence and absence of sound, create your own sound maker and tell a sound story. Emphasise the potential of peer group learning in co-constructed environments and reflect on the educator’s impact on group dynamics.

This STEM learning opportunity will help you:

  • recognise how co-constructed environments support peer group learning

  • reflect on the role of the educator in enhancing children’s verbal and non-verbal communication with peers

  • experience the effects of group dynamics on the learner

  • explore the world of sound by listening to the environment

  • discover acoustics by producing sounds, making noise and experiencing silence

  • benefit from the exchange with like-minded educators and reflect on your current practice

  • feel confident in unlocking the wonders of STEM

You will also receive comprehensive materials with lots of STEM ideas and information about inquiry-based practices.

Feedback

"Literally best PD ever!". Kirsty Myers

Good to know: This workshop provides educators and teachers with a variety of tools and educational concepts to meet a range of requirements of the NQF and the EYLF.

Little Scientists workshops are endorsed to provide NESA Registered Professional Development for teachers accredited at Proficient Teacher level. Each workshop counts as five hours and 30 minutes of PD.

Date: Thursday, 23 April 2020

Time: 9:30am - 4:30pm

Location: Gowrie Training Room, Level 1, 1 Elliott Avenue, Erskineville NSW 2043

Public transport: The closest train station is Erskineville Station and is a 5 mins walk from the venue.

Parking: Parking is available around surrounding streets of the venue.

Further information: Wear clothing suitable for hands-on activities and experiments.

Cost: $200 per person. Ticket cost includes morning and afternoon tea. Please BYO lunch.

Who? This workshop is suitable for all educators and teachers and prior STEM knowledge is not required.

Facilitator: Lena Hammond, Little Scientists trainer

Bring a friend. We know from experience that people who come along with a friend or colleague tend to get more out of the workshop. If you know someone who’d benefit from this workshop, send them this link to find out more and join your workshop.

Please note: The workshop is for educators and teachers only and it is not suitable for children to attend.

Questions? Email us at workshops@littlescientists.org.au 

Terms and Conditions

Completing this workshop will contribute 5 hours and 30 minutes of NSW Education Standards Authority (NESA) Registered PD addressing Standard Descriptors 2.1.2, 3.3.2 and 6.2.2 from the Australian Professional Standards for Teachers towards maintaining Proficient Teacher Accreditation in NSW.

events.name: Getting Started with Essential Oils - Coogee
events.summary: Heard about essential oils? Maybe you already use them? Maybe you have always wanted to find out more? What if I said there was a way to liv
events.description_html:
Heard about essential oils? Maybe you already use them? Maybe you have always wanted to find out more? What if I said there was a way to live a more natural and healthier life? Would you want to find out more?

Essential oils can enhance so many areas of your daily life. They're often used for immune support, relaxation and sleep, stress relief, emotional balance, skin care, respiratory health, cleaning, and even muscle tension and pain.

Here's your opportiunity to find out more. We are going to give you all the tools to help get started with essential oils.

You will learn about essential oil safety, how essential oils are produced, and common methods of use. You'll also learn how to create a more natural, healthy lifestyle through the use of essential oils.

Some of the topics we will be covering on the day include:

  • What essential oils are?

  • How they work

  • How they are produced

  • Managing stress with essential oils

  • Natural remedies for everyday ailments and sniffles

  • Dealing with sleep problems the natural way

You will have opportunities to experience essential oils first hand and understand the best way to source oils for you and your family.

If you have any questions, please contact us at hello@welloiledmachine.co.uk.

We look forward to meeting you.

events.name: INTRODUCTORY COURSE: FILTER COFFEE AT HOME
events.summary: In the 90-minute Filter Coffee at Home course, we introduce you to Campos, the world of specialty coffee and brewing filter coffee at home.
events.description_html: In the 90-minute Filter Coffee at Home course, we introduce you to Campos, the world of specialty coffee and brewing filter coffee at home.

events.name: Virtual drawing with Non Dominant Hand (NDH). Trust me it'd get better
events.description_html:
Let's draw with our Non Donimant Hand (NDH). I've been using my NDH for a month and it's addictive. It's awkward in the begining, but trust me it'd get better. It forces you to slow down. You feel like learning how to walk for the first time. It's ok to be squiggly. New styles may emerge from your NDH.
A few tips:
- It's good to use thick markers or crayons - less squiggly
- Start from the opposite end of the page to avoid smudging
- Subjects are endless - still life, portrait, landscape etc

events.name: FREE - Zoom Meetup - Tuesday April 21, 2020 @ Noon
events.description_html:
ONLINE Zoom Tuesday, April 21st at NOON

Let's all get together and have a chat, let's find out how we all are, and just say hello. And find out what each of us are doing to keep our "artist" side alive during this outbreak.

And perhaps do a little improvisation "warm up exercise" - life will help you with this - believe me. its simple.

This is the 4th Zoom Meeting I am setting up for South Florida Actors, Tampa Bay Actors and Public Speakers in Florida - All are welcome.

You can RSVP Below, and we will send you the Zoom Meeting ID and Pass code.

Stay safe, be diligent when going out and most of all stay kind to all you meet.

Sara Rogers

events.name: "Fireside Chat" Online Meetup
events.organiser: Spark your inner Fire - Creatives, Artists, & Closet Artists
events.description_html:
Creatives! Lets meetup face to face (online.) I'm looking forward to meeting each and every one of you!
This will be an uplifting positive time for us all to collaborate and support one another. Let's take this hour to get our minds off the chaos =)

Please RSVP to receive the link to join. I will message you the password separately for security purposes.

Let me know if you have any questions and if there is a time/day that would work better for future calls, please let me know.

events.name: Staying Connected
events.organiser: Rockland Singles 50 Plus Afternoon Walks, Hikes, Arts & Ent.
events.description_html:
I am following in our friend and wonderful organizer Martines' footsteps in setting up this "on line, daily meetup". It will be for the duration of this pandemic or until it no longer seems needed.

The purpose of this "daily meetup" is to keep everyone connected and to share what you are doing to get thru this challenging time.

Feel free to share photos of scenic places you have been to or are going to during this time, poetry, inspirational secular quotes, tasteful links to jokes and utubes to uplift our spirits, recipes, exercise utubes, etc.

Other activities we can continue to do are gardening, feeding the birds, enjoying our wildlife, star gazing, reading, online classes, dancing, drumming, chanting, singing, arts and crafts, bicycling, walks and hikes on your own and everything keeping a 6 foot social distance. Ideally the least amount of people you come into contact with the better for everyone. This is a good time to de-clutter if you have the inspiration, catch up with old friends and family by phone, letters, emails, FaceTime, etc.

There are also volunteer opportunities but first and mostly take care of yourself and your health by washing your hands often, avoiding touching your face, using disinfectant wipes and hand sanitizers with 60% or more of alcohol, using masks and disposable gloves where there are large crowds like supermarkets. Avoid carpooling, food sharing and gathering in confined places. As many of us are in the over 60 "kid" crowd, we need to be especially careful as we have become "delicate flowers" !

There will always be some conflicting info out there so it is always best to err on the side of caution until this passes. To a brighter tomorrow and may we share many more good times in the months and years to come! May the Force be With Us! With much love and healing wishes.

events.name: Community Zoom | Goods, Gripes & Goals
events.organiser: The Creative Impostor: Chicago Women's Collective
events.description_html:
Community Zoom | Goods, Gripes & Goals

Join us for the one Zoom you won't actually dread!

Part social, part productivity, never any pressure! Let's meetup online via Zoom (be sure to install on your computer or mobile device ahead of time at https://zoom.us/) for a 40-minute refresher to your week.

Some of us are still working (from home) and some of us are trying to get creative about making sure we still HAVE work (ahem... clients...) and some of us are just working on getting through.

Wherever you are, whatever you're working on, I wanna see your face and/or hear your voice.

We'll each share something "good" from the past few days (as momentous or minute as you wish), a "gripe" or something really challenging us (as light or heavy as you need to get off your chest), and ONE goal or intention for the day (from professional to personal -- it's all valid!)

Join Zoom Meeting
https://us04web.zoom.us/j/3667771000

This is a come-as-you-are meetup. Pajamas, lip gloss or chandelier earrings... coffee, green smoothie, or Bloody Mary... cat, dog, or toddler in the background... we're happy to have you!

events.name: Tuesday Afternoon Figure Drawing/Painting
events.organiser: Tuesday Afternoon Life Drawing Group – Santa Fe
events.description_html:
Drawing and painting from the model, $15 fee per person. No reservations necessary.

This drawing group combines gesture-pose warmups with a long-pose format.

Models are engaged across several weeks for continuity. Periodically a single pose is sustained for multiple sessions to develop a finished piece. We use single-source lighting for classical modeling.

We're a congenial group that prefers a smaller-size gathering. We meet weekly and welcome any skill level.

events.name: Live Sketching of Events
events.organiser: Chicago Sketching for UX, Design, and Innovation
events.description_html:
Join Len Peralta for “Live Sketching of Events." Len is a Freelance Illustrator, and his quirky, offbeat style has become synonymous with geek culture. Len is behind the online viral art projects Monster By Mail, 50 vs 50 and FlipFace.
-----------------
This is a live, online-only event. It will be on the Hopin platform. You must get a ticket using the following link:
https://hopin.to/events/Chicago-Sketching-Meetup-200421
The Meetup RSVP only indicates your interest. You need to register on Hopin for your ticket.
-----------------
Len Peralta will talk about he calls graphic recording. It can also be called live visual note taking. It’s a way to cite something live that helps distill the point of the talk into an easy-to-visualize way. Len has done this technique for conferences like ConveyUX. In this presentation, Len show his work and talk about his process and techniques.

Schedule:

1:45p CDT - Virtual space opens
2:00p CDT - Presentation & Q&A
3:00p CDT - Virtual networking
3:35p CDT - Closing comments
3:45p CDT - Adjourn

events.name: Tuesday 2pm Live Streamimg Life Drawing with Audio support
events.organiser: London Art Classes - Drawing & Painting / Life Drawing
events.description_html:
This is an Online Class, very similar to a regular class, that brings more and more Artists, enthusiasts and beginners together to draw the Human figure no matter where they are in the World.
A few Art teachers, like myself, and Art models run or tutor the class just like if it was a real Life Drawing class, except that everyone is comfy and not conscious about their drawings.
You can now, keep on being creative at home and forget the pain and sadness we are all of us in together.
If you can't make it to the online class or want to see its recording to be able to finish your work, you can now hire it, by the month, for as long as you wish, for the cost of a single class monthly or about 3 euros/week. This is simply a dream come true, as the more you draw the better you get.
At every session artists can show their work, get tips & advice, on and off screen, they can switch on/off their camera, clap our model in unison, give me a shout if they have a video/audio problem, use the chat function for any questions and hear interesting stories and anecdotes from me, the teachers, the models or from the participants. You can talk to others at the break or at the end. There is no rush.
I am based in London where I made as much noise as possible from 2003, ran thousands of classes with many themes I created and founded thelifedrawingnetwork.net and .com that I am both updating in this time of isolation.

For our Live sessions we insist, on you guys, to put at least one of your drawings up on meetup photos so we know that we all are here to draw.

You now need to download and install Zoom.us app on your device and go to our New website: https://www.thelifedrawingnetwork.com/event-details/tuesday-2pm-live-life-drawing-2 where you'll be able to buy your ticket at £6. The recorded video of this session will be available to hire for an unlimited period of time for £10, the next week at https://www.thelifedrawingnetwork.com/last-week-live-recordings.
I think we should start competitions asap as we never had it that great in term of availability, costs and interest.
If you'd like to join your London Life Drawing group/Mini Network please go to our community website at https://thelifedrawingnetwork.net/groups/draw-life-in-london-uk

After the class please make sure you share your drawing on:
- FB in our group: Daily Life Drawing from Live Streaming (Globally Together) or on our The Life Drawing Network page
- Instagram (Lifedrawing Tony) or big groups such as #Lifedrawing, as this could help many people you know to go through this period much better.
In the future I will invite other good teachers to talk/stream as well as Artists who want to show you their work...
This is simply unlimited what we can do here together now with video streaming. Big thanks again to Meetup for continuing to improve our World.
We welcome groups such as families or flatmates to get in touch so we can sort something out for them.

events.name: *online* Crowdfunding! mit Anne Eck
events.organiser: Network for Artists, Creatives and Freelancers
events.description_html:
// English below //

Diese Veranstaltung findet online statt! Achtung, geänderte Uhrzeit.

Update:
Online via Zoom: https://us02web.zoom.us/j/83532163832 (Meeting-ID:[masked])
Freie Teilnahme, offen für alle, keine Anmeldung nötig!

Auf vielfachen Wunsch gibt es eine Neuauflage des Crowdfunding-Workshops von Anne Eck!
Diesmal tun wir uns zusammen mit Anne und ihrem Label Silvertree Records, die Teilnahme ist offen für alle – Smart-User*innen und alle anderen Lernfreudigen!

Workshop-Info von Anne Eck:

Kreative Projekte entstehen nicht von heute auf morgen und selten über Nacht. Künstler*innen, Musiker*innen, Kreative arbeiten oft jahrelang an sich und ihrem Projekt. Ein wesentlicher Punkt ist dabei vor allem die Finanzierung. Gerade wenn es mit einer Förderung nicht klappt oder der eigene Spartopf aufgebraucht ist, stellt das Crowdfunding eine wirkliche & lohnende Alternative dar!

ANNE ECK, Singer & Songwriterin & Labelchefin von Silvertree Records e.U. hat 2016 damals selbst den Entschluss gefasst Ihre erste EP RISE mithilfe einer Crowdfunding Kampagne zu realisieren – und das höchst erfolgreich. Mit über 100 Unterstützer*innen, dem Bank Austria Kunst- und Kulturpreis und über[masked]€ konnte sie sich die gesamte Produktion realisieren.

In diesem Workshop teilt Anne ihr Wissen und ihre Erfahrungen mit den Smart-User*innen – übrigens auch die Fehler, denn daraus lernt man ja bekanntlich am meisten ;-): Was braucht es alles für eine Crowdfunding Kampagne, Tips & Tricks, Do’s and Dont’s – vor allem aber bringt sie Licht ins Dunkel, macht Mut, das ganz eigene Projekt zu verwirklichen und loszugehen für das, was da kreativ so herumschwirrt und raus will in einem! (Chaka!)

Wir freuen uns auf euch!

/////

We'll host this event online! Please note the slight time change.

Update: Online via Zoom: https://us02web.zoom.us/j/83532163832 (meeting ID:[masked])
Free of charge, open for all, no registration required!

By popular request we’re hosting a new edition of Anne Eck’s Crowdfunding workshop!
This time, we’re teaming up with Anne and her label Silvertree Records, so all are welcome – Smart users as well as everybody else who wants to learn about crowdfunding!*

*Note: This workshop will be held in German.

events.name: Reclaim Your Space! Online Relaxation: Switch 'Work at Home' to 'Be at Home'
events.description_html:
“Don’t take your work home with you!” How are you meant to do that when you are working from home?! The purpose of these shorter 5pm relaxation / gentle yoga / meditation sessions is to aid that transition from ‘working’ at home to ‘being’ at home! You still need to reclaim your personal space from your work space so you can enjoy the evening, whether that’s by yourself or with family or housemates, it’s still ‘you’ time!

So in these shorter sessions, we will be doing super accessible but yet potent relaxation exercises to help drop your work thoughts out of your mind and reconnect to your own thoughts, feelings, creativity and body-mind.

Spending so long in your head during the day needs to be balanced by giving your body some care and attention – your attention has got power – instead of putting it outside of yourself let it nourish every cell in your own body!

WHAT WILL WE DO?

These sessions will draw upon:
- Gentle Movement / Dru Yoga
- Breathing Exercises
- Meditation
- Mindfulness
- Sound Exercises
- Self Massage

NATURALLY RELAXED

Yoga, meditation and mindfulness makes you naturally relaxed. We often think that sitting in front of the TV with a glass of red and chocolate is relaxing but actually that just trances you out, with your nervous system still over-stimulated. These practices change your brainwave patterns and hormones so you feel more present and enjoy the journey of life more! So come and join me for a truly holistic experience!

ABOUT RICHARD’S YOGA

I teach beautiful Dru Yoga, a yoga of the Heart. While other practices may have a more physical or Asana (posture) focus, the challenge in Dru is to embrace the stillness and get comfortable with yourself! And indeed this can be the ultimate challenge! You may be physically very adept, but contacting your inner self in this way can be a new challenge and is a courageous path as when you take your attention inside and embrace the thoughts and emotions that we are often keen to run from or be distracted from.

WEEKLY SCHEDULE & HOW TO JOIN (VIA ZOOM)

Join Zoom Meeting
https://zoom.us/j/485511752?pwd=eVNiaC9zdWxaU2RPc2I4d2JiV3Q3QT09

Meeting ID:[masked]
Password: megarest

If you feel the impulse, I am also open to receiving donations for offering these sessions, and they would be appreciated.
https://www.paypal.me/RichardBrook22

This Week's Full Schedule (please note some of these are only listed via the Creative Wellness website or Facebook page - please see links at foot of listing)

Tuesday 5 - 5.30pm - Reclaim Your Space
Wednesday 5- 5.30pm - Reclaim Your Space
Wednesday 6 - 7.30pm - Super Relaxing Yoga with Rich
Thursday 5 - 5.30pm - NO CLASS THIS WEEK

CHALLENGING TIMES

Finally, these are challenging times, and we need practices which bring us back to our centre, back to the sense of security of our own heart and soul and help to transcend the current circumstances. For me this is, and has always been, the deeper essence of yoga and all the practices we offer.

Look after yourselves,

Richard

STAY IN TOUCH

Please follow me to keep up to date with all the good stuff going on!

Website: www.creativewellness.co.uk
Facebook: www.facebook.com/creativewellnessuk
Instagram: richard.brook
Youtube: www.youtube.com/richardbrookacu

SUPPORT AT WORK

I also offer corporate classes - if you want to harangue your HR to offer these classes to you all working at home, please go ahead and direct them to www.corporateyogalondon.co.uk - thanks!

events.description_html:
Even in the best of times, writing can be a lonely experience. It's easier when you know you're not alone. And it's good to make the commitment to writing by getting it on your calendar and sticking to it. This is a virtual Meetup. If you sign up for this event, make sure you have notifications turned on so you see comments as they are posted. Post comments on this page to say when you arrive and when you leave.

This is a virtual session. We'll get together on Zoom, chat sometime in the middle about what we're doing, and show off our pets to each other.

events.name: 'The Secrets of Brooklyn Heights' Virtual Exploration
events.description_html:
Click link below for full info and to get tickets (thanks for your support during these crazy times!:
https://bit.ly/SecretsOfBrooklynHeights

Description:
From its beginnings in the early 1800s as a retreat for wealthy New Yorkers escaping the overcrowding of lower Manhattan, to the modern neighborhood that looks much like it did 100 years ago, Brooklyn Heights has a fascinating history to tell, one that in many ways mirrors the journey of New York itself. This is the story of where modern Brooklyn was born, and why it remains one of the most prominent and vital neighborhoods in all of New York City.

Join New York Adventure Club as we explore the rich tapestry and lesser-known tales of Brooklyn Heights, a New York City neighborhood that has shaped American history and culture throughout the past 200 years.

Led by NYC Tour Guide Michael Morgenthal, our virtual exploration of this small, yet influential waterfront neighborhood will include:

> A look at its pivotal role in The American Revolution, and how The Continental Army was almost squashed there in 1776
> A discussion around the many religious institutions based in the neighborhood, including the rise and recent departure of the Jehovah's Witnesses
> Stories of the neighborhood's strong ties to the abolitionist movement, from homes that were reputed stops on the Underground Railroad to pastor Henry Ward Beecher of Plymouth Church, whose strong support for the abolition of slavery enticed Abraham Lincoln to speak there on several occasions
> A deep dive into literary giants who called Brooklyn Heights their home, including Walt Whitman, Truman Capote, and Thomas Wolfe
The past, present, and future of development and preservation in Brooklyn Heights, from the construction of the Brooklyn Bridge, to the birth of the landmarks preservation movement, to the Brooklyn–Queens Expressway's (BQE) construction and now controversial plans for its reconstruction

Afterward, we'll have a Q&A with Mike — any and all questions about Brooklyn Heights are welcomed and encouraged!

Click link below for full info and to get tickets (thanks for your support during these crazy times!:
https://bit.ly/SecretsOfBrooklynHeights

events.name: DOMESTICITY IN ART 13:  Drouais - Madame de Pompadour at her Tambour Frame 1763
events.description_html:
A donation of £1 or more is suggested. If you make the access code available to friends and family, please chip in for them, or better still ask them to join the meet-up group. Please make advance weekly payments into this dedicated bank account.

Ms L Bauman
[masked]
[masked]
IBAN GB54 NWBK[masked]

For the foreseeable future and to cheer us all up, I’ll be hosting daily mini meet-ups showcasing a single image from the history of European Art, on the subject very close to our hearts at the moment : Domesticity in Art.
Most but not all of the paintings will come from the National Gallery, so that we can continue enjoying and learning from this magnificent collection in Trafalgar Square. I’ll be offering them in chronological order so that you might
learn about the progression of the history of painting, about artists, periods, techniques, societies and their customs.
Much of human drama happens on the domestic scene and much of it across the ages is similar to ours today. You will see that confinement to the home, when not due to national lockdown, can have other reasons and purposes and with each painting you’ll find a cheery take away that things could be worse!
You will need to download ZOOM and use the meeting ID which will be provided after you rsvp to gain direct access

events.name: BNI T.E.A.M. - Networking, Introductions, and Business Referrals
events.organiser: BNI T.E.A.M. - San Diego Networking & Business Referrals
events.description_html:
Leaders in the local business community meet regularly to maintain a pulse on local business, build professional relationships, and increase the impact of their own endeavors via personal introductions and warm referrals.

Our mission is to help local professionals increase their influence and impact through a structured, positive and professional environment which enables development of long-term, meaningful relationships with quality business professionals.

Each week regular participants and visitors all have a brief opportunity to stand and share trends in their businesses and where they add value for others. The agenda also intentionally includes time to help others with networking connections and business referrals. In this environment, givers gain!

Maintaining ongoing professional relationships benefits businesses through all market cycles, as people continue to do business with - and refer people - that they know, like and trust.

Grateful for our alliance with BNI, we are an exclusive category organization that allows only one person per professional classification to participate regularly. VISITORS ARE WELCOMED! We value the opportunity to connect with new visitors at all events posted on our Meetup calendar. If you are a leader in your field, we'd love to meet you.

Meetings are nearly every week throughout the year (with some holiday exceptions). The meeting fee of $25 includes buffet breakfast, beverages, and parking validation (when applicable).

Visitors should come prepared with a thick stack of business cards. These will be passed around the room for you. First-time visitors are encouraged to check-in no later than 6:45am. There is a short visitor orientation at 8:25am where more information is available - and questions answered - regarding BNI.

Our weekly event is one of the very best ways to connect and gain visibility within the local business community. We look forward to meeting you soon and learning more about your endeavors.

More information on the group is also at:
https://bnisd.com/ca-san-diego-county-west-bni-team/en-US/index

BNI is the world's leading referral organization. More information is at:
https://www.bni.com
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BNI_(organization)

events.description_html:

Only one person from each profession specialty is allowed to join a chapter of BNI, eliminating the possibility of competition among our members. When you join a chapter, you are the sole representative of your field and can develop relationships with others in the chapter as their go-to person for your services.

The businesses our members represent are their full-time occupations, ensuring they are able to position themselves as resources and experts in their field.

Arrive on time always so you don’t miss out on any opportunities for networking.

We welcome ONE PROFESSIONAL PER TRADE, and promote our members through various venues, and meet weekly. Come and join our next meeting, to see if a membership with NC25 can take your business to the NEXT level, and be sure to bring a stack of your business cards!

Please refer to our "About Us" section to see which professional categories are currently taken. And please feel free to message here to confirm your business category is open and available.

NC25 is an established sales team of community professionals; always listening for sales opportunities for our members. We are always ready to share our own personal knowledge of our member's talents, experience, and specific skills. We meet every week, and regular attendance is vital to our success.

If this is your first meeting, PLEASE be sure to bring plenty of business cards to share, and be ready to share information about your business. You are welcome to visit us twice before deciding if you want to apply to become a permanent member.

Upon officially joining, There is a $25 application fee, and dues are $50 per month. Once you are approved as a member, your breakfast is paid for at every meeting. All materials provided to you within the group are included in these fees, as well.

We warmly welcome new female business professionals to come and visit us. We are privately owned, so there is no corporation managing our time or money. Come and see how networking is supposed to be.

PLEASE NOTE - IF YOU RSVP, PLEASE ANSWER OUR QUESTIONS SO WE KNOW YOU WILL ATTEND. THANK YOU!

events.name: Burro Wash Road in Boulder City
events.description_html:
Burro Wash is a 4x4 trail that ends in a cove on the Colorado River. This is an Out & Back trail

Rated 3-4(Moderate).
Stock Wrangler or equivalent will be fine, with 4x4. Heavy duty all terrain tires with working spare. CB recommended but not required.
Desert pin-striping possible.

This scenic route follows a dirt and rock trail that initially runs along the power lines before passing through Black Canyon and traveling down a wash. This trail will have some minor washed out areas, slightly off camber spots, and minor fun rocky obstacles.

Bring your food and water, we will stop for lunch on the Colorado River

We will play that by ear given the daily change in circumstances.

We have a great mix of riders - Men and Women and variety of bikes - Cruisers, sport bikes, adventure, etc... We go all over the place and our leaders usually decide on the moment where that is, and we have lots of fun!

This is a casual ride. If it’s raining you may be on your own as many of us will not ride in inclement weather. We do not manage and notify canceled rides.

events.name: Chuck's Wednesday Ride to Nowhere
events.description_html:
This will be a weekly ride about 40 to 70 miles and about 60 - 90 minutes long. Each week will take us on a different route through Volusia, Lake, Marion and/or Flagler counties. Chuck has a few routes already planned, but he is open to any new route suggestions.

Let's end Hump Day with a relaxing ride to nowhere. We will always meet at the BP gas station at 2185 W New York Ave W, FL-44, DeLand, FL 32720 (on West 44 at the roundabout). Meetup time is 5:45pm with KSU (kick stands up) at 6:00pm. Make sure you fill your tanks before the ride as we do not make any stops. Guests are always welcome, so please feel free to bring a passenger and/or other riders. This is a rain or shine event, so bring your rain gear just in case. We will cancel the ride if the weather is determined to be too dangerous for riding.

For more information or questions, contact Chuck at [masked]. If you are going to attend a ride, but are running late, text Chuck at [masked]. We leave promptly at 6pm unless I know you are on your way.

Please take time to fill out our "After Action Survey" after the ride. Your feedback will help us understand where we excel and where we may be falling behind. Your submission is anonymous (unless you include an email address for a response), so please don't hold back on the good and/or bad. Our goal is to make this a fun ride for everyone! You can find the survey at this link: https://www.theallriders.com/aas

events.name: ARISE Film Viewing
events.description_html:
Available for a limited time to celebrate Earth Day 2020
https://vimeo.com/58051765?fbclid=IwAR0kR6fQ6tsk-p39o9_NrCU-HBA1b0h-UUecZ5llsN8kSbvBTrnOjxkmaAs

Watch the film ARISE
Narrated by actress and environmental activist, Daryl Hannah, ARISE is an award winning documentary that is extremely timely and relevant to our times. As Starhawk points out in her opening statement, “We are at the environmental crisis of our lifetime, perhaps of humanities lifetime”, and it is the women who are taking leadership roles in regards to the issues they are facing in their communities, cities, towns and villages. This worldly documentary inspires the viewer to create change and empowers them to be a part of this amazing movement that is emerging all around the globe in response to climate change and environmental challenges. ARISE is becoming a movement, not just a film.

Arise weaves together beautiful moving images to tell a story with many stories. The viewer is able to experience 13 different women’s voices in 13 different places throughout the world with the help of Narrator Daryl Hannah, poetry by poets such as Alice Walker, music by well known artists like Michael Franti, Moby and many more. As reviewer Martine Joseph explains, “Exquisite cinematography and music are enhanced by Daryl Hannah’s evocative narration.”

At a time when we are being bombarded by films and videos depicting the end times and doomsday reports of environmental crisis. ARISE is a hopeful message that inspires people by providing solutions and encouraging them to be apart of the positive changes that are taking place on the planet. We believe people are hungry to be inspired and empowered to create change in their lives and in the world and ARISE appeals to people of all backgrounds regardless of their race, gender, nationality and spiritual beliefs.

ARISE appeals to a diverse audience from women’s, food justice and environmental groups. The film has won the Spirit of Activism Award at the Colorado Environmental Film Festival and the Shifty Award at Filmshift and been the official selection at a dozen film festivals here in the US as well as the Bahamas, Australia, France and Argentina.

Directed by mother/daughter team, Lori Joyce and Candice Orlando, together we were able to bring diverse voices to the screen, tell the stories of amazing women using beautiful imagery, inspire viewers to create change and built a strong relationship together doing so.

Arise has received positive reviews from the Huffington Post & the Hollywood
Progressive, describing the film as, “Arise is both a documentary and an ethnographic study of women from around the world who share a profound intellectual and spiritual understanding of what it takes to live in harmony with the environment."

events.name: Funding for Cities' Covid-19/ Climate Response for City Goverments
events.description_html:
Are you a member of city government?

We know how to fund cities' response to dual climate and health emergencies. The Bay Area CRC has launched a new campaign, the Health and Climate Resilience Credit and Tax Large Polluters Measure.

We invite you to join our weekly calls as we present how Cities can place a measure on the Nov. 2020 ballot to raise revenue for the Covid-19 and Climate Emergencies. Experts will present the legal, political and electoral realities of this revenue source for every City.

Join Tuesdays at 4:00 (link below) to discuss how your city can declare a climate emergency and bring about true climate action.

events.name: Best Practices for Promoting Regenerative Agriculture
events.description_html:
Are you alarmed about the effect the COVID-19 crisis is having on our food system — the cost, availability and quality of food; the health and well-being of farmworkers; the economic toll?

Are you looking for ways to help create a local, resilient food system and stable economy?

Then join us in a conversation on how to build an affordable, healthy, equitable and regenerative organic food system.

We will discuss:
- Economic liquidity for consumers, allowing people to afford and pay for food
- Access to Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) and farmers’ markets, grocery stores, delivery services
- Double Up SNAP program
- Community engagement, supporting farmers’ markets, family farms, catering organizations, food processors, restaurants
- Community-based currency

We will also cover:
- Community actions that promote local regenerative organic food and agriculture
- Policy actions that fund and support regenerative organic agriculture practices
- Economic incentives that stimulate market access between local producers and customers

In preparation for our discussion, please have a look at these slides (paste link in browser):
https://drive.google.com/file/d/10OZ3WId8u2Ph0ge2khTlTPWswB-5JUWk/view

Webinar Registration link will be visible below to people who RSVP.

events.name: Rendezvous w/Renewal [virtual] Trailhead!
events.description_html:
At the start of each of our Beauty Walks we rendezvous at the trailhead, we circle up, get oriented to each other and to the place, and we ground into a shared intention that will guide us into our deep encounter with wild nature.

It’s been a while since we could gather in person. It’ll be a while yet. And we miss our Trailhead time!

Join with others from the Renewal in the Wilderness community for some [virtual] Trailhead time on Tuesdays at 5:30pm. This isn’t meant to replace your connection with wild nature. We’re making a big assumption that most of you are already finding ways most days to get outside.

Check in here for weekly RSVP links: http://www.renewalinthewilderness.org/trailhead

This Trailhead time is meant to make a little space for us to connect as a community and for us to share a weekly intention (something we can all commit to noticing or practicing) that will deepen our day-to-day encounters with the elements.

We’ll gather, get oriented to each other and the space, do some grounding, share an intention, and go out in solidarity. The whole thing will take around 30 minutes, leaving you plenty of time afterward to go outside before the sun sets.

—

Note: We’ll be gathering [virtually] via Zoom.
If you’re new to Zoom, check out this link to learn about: Joining a Meeting.
And if you want to familiarize yourself with Zoom in advance you can: Join a test meeting.

events.name: *VIRTUAL* Dining In For Life 2020: The Sausage Factory
events.description_html:
>> PLEASE READ THIS DESCRIPTION COMPLETELY. ADDITIONAL INFO IS REQUESTED <<
>> PLEASE DO *NOT* RSVP FOR THIS EVENT UNDER *BOTH* BRIDGEMEN AND 50-PLUS! <<

Dining IN For Life (fka Dining OUT For Life) is an annual dining fundraiser benefitting San Francisco AIDS Foundation (SFAF). With the current Shelter In Place order, Wi-Fi is the new dinner table. This year, Dining IN For Life will encourage participants to order either food for delivery or pick-up on the day of the event OR gift cards to use at a later date, whether in SF or East Bay.

50-Plus and Bridgemen will be treating members to a meal from The Sausage Factory for either delivery to a San Francisco address or pick-up by members. Though delivery is an option, it’s more time-consuming and complicated for the restaurant. Therefore, for members who live close to the restaurant and who FEEL SAFE AND COMFORTABLE doing so, we’re encouraging them to drop by the restaurant in person to pick up their orders, following all social-distancing guidelines and precautions while doing so. Alex will be on site to help coordinate pick-ups and deliveries.

For members who opt out of a meal on the day of the event, you may receive a $25 gift card for use at a later date. The gift card will be mailed to you.

Please note this is not an open invitation. For this event, we are prioritizing active members, meaning those who have attended at least one 50-Plus/Bridgemen event since Oct 1, 2019. A single guest may also participate with prior approval. Please contact us with questions.

FOLLOW THIS LINK TO SUBMIT YOUR ORDER BY MON, 4/20, 3 PM:
https://forms.gle/B7ZWU25dHNRXiioM6

events.name: Daily 6 PM LIVE BROADCASTS on Nature & Outdoor Skills - Details in Description
events.organiser: Outdoor Education in Tacoma, Olympia and the South Sound
events.description_html:
Join us every day at 6 PM for Facebook Live & Youtube Streaming broadcasts of our “You Healthy? Go Outside!” - Family Friendly Music & Earth Skills Activities with Kim & Chris Chisholm, Wolf Camp and the Conservation College at Blue Skye Farm. Try https://www.facebook.com/wolfcampcollege/live and we'll also post every broadcast afterwards to https://www.wolfcollege.com/category/blog/broadcast-series-outdoor-skills-for-physical-distancing/ where you can topics watch all the way back to Day 1 when we started on March 16th.

NOTE: We really want to broadcast live on YouTube where we need 1,000 subscribers before they will let us live stream via our phone in the field, so PLEASE go to https://www.youtube.com/wolfcampcollege/ to subscribe and then ask all your family and friends to subscribe as well. Also please consider a donation if you enjoy the video lesson and would like to help keep Wolf Camp administrative staff employed through springtime: https://www.wolfcollege.com/about/keep-spring-staff-employed-during-social-distancing/

UPCOMING TOPICS: We encourage you to offer suggestions on Virtual Earth Skills Camp lessons and adventures you’d like us to broadcast in the coming. Our plans for the coming week include:

Sunday: Setting Up Small $100 Solar Systems

We are hoping that sometime during the week of the 50th Anniversary of Earth Day, April 22 we can launch the online version of the Wolf Journey Earth Conservation Course revealing each field experience on daily broadcasts, but only if we get to 1,000 subscribers on YouTube which is the number they require for live streaming from phones in the field. We’ll keep broadcasting to our Wolf Camp Facebook page as a back-up, but will end broadcasts to Chris’ personal facebook page when YouTube subscriptions reach the 1,000 needed.

Announcements & Reminders:

– If you have time on your hands and you feel you’re not in a high risk group, see if your fire station, hospital, social service organization or other essential facility has a suggestion on how you can can get trained to support them. Staple businesses like grocery stores may even be hiring.

– If you still have an income or extra money, see if or when your fire station, hospital or other essential facility would appreciate delivery of a take-out order for one of their meals – it’s a great way to support small businesses too. Don’t forget essential non-profits which also need to keep people employed, and your favorite performing artists and venues which have little chance for income at this time.

– We believe that going outside is the healthiest way to maintain happiness while social distancing, where virus concentrations dissipate in the fresh air and can even get killed by extended exposure to ultraviolet (UV) rays. It’s where the sun helps us produce Vitamin D, keeping us happy and well. Gardening, in particular, is a great way to stay healthy, and if things get sparse, one of the best ways to increase food security.

events.name: Permaculture Design Masterclass online with Kareen Erbe
events.description_html:
Meets on Tuesdays for 4 weeks via zoom. To register and for more information go to: https://www.brokengroundpermaculture.com/permaculture-design-online-masterclass.html

This is a new online course offered by outstanding permaculture teacher and designer Kareen Erbe of Broken Ground Permaculture in Bozeman Montana. Don't miss this excellent opportunity.

"Learn how to design a homestead that captures water, improves your soil and produces healthy organic food!

Permaculture and growing our own food is the solution to a lot of problems we face today - health issues, ecological crises, climate change and pollution. Learn how to reduce your water, energy and grocery bills while creating a delicious and edible landscape!

If you want to be more self-reliant, grow your own food, and create a sustainable future for yourself and your family, join Broken Ground for this online masterclass. Whether you have a balcony, a backyard or a 10-acre plot of land, this group class will empower you to design a healthy and bountiful life that goes beyond sustainable."

events.name: “Europe & the Refugee Crisis”.. ...with STCP Director, Peter DeWit
events.organiser: Serve the City Paris: International Volunteer Opportunities
events.description_html:
SERVE THE CITY PARIS ONLINE WORKSHOP SERIES PRESENTS:

“Europe & the Refugee Crisis”..
...with STCP Director, Peter DeWit

Tuesday, April 21st, 2020 at 18h.

This workshop will be facilitated by STCP Director, Peter DeWit who has spent much of his life working with and aiding refugees in Canada, Southwest Asia and Europe.

Our world is witnessing the largest migration of people since World War II. Millions have been forcibly displaced from their homes and countries creating a human crisis across the whole globe. With the CoVid19 virus combined with climate change, Europe is faced with an even more daunting challenge going forward.

This workshop will look at Europe’s response, and also the 'push factors' that have forced millions to flee in the first place. We'll put a human face on this crisis, so we all become more informed, empathetic, and engaged as volunteers. We’ll discuss your thoughts on the crisis as well, and solutions you have in mind as active humanitarian volunteers.

To participate, download Zoom at https://zoom.us/download
Launch the Zoom browser or the Zoom app
Join the Zoom Meeting at:
https://zoom.us/j/99352170078
Meeting ID:[masked]
Optional local Dial in number: [masked]
(or try [masked], or [masked])

During this time of crisis, we are offering the course FREE of charge. (normally the course is 15 euros).

If you would like to make a donation to our non-profit association, the link is https://www.servethecity.paris/donate/. All donations go towards the purchase of food for our current Food Delivery Program we are currently operating weekly for refugees and homeless in Paris.

____________

BECOME A SERVE THE CITY PARIS VOLUNTEER
We would be excited for you to join our already 2,000+ international volunteers who help those in need in Paris.

Our team of volunteers participate in volunteer activities offered 5 days a week, including interactive workshops and monthly events. Any given week, our Volunteers help deliver food to refugees and the homeless, teach English and French to refugees, participate in sports activities with refugees, work at a Soup Kitchen for the homeless, attend one of our monthly integration events, or join Serve The City P.A.I.R. (“Program to Aid & Integrate Refugees”).

If you are interested in joining our team of volunteers, and participating in our volunteer activities, (or if you have an interest to present your own online workshop relating to social impact), please contact us at [masked].

To learn more about Serve the City Paris, please see our website: www.servethecity.paris.

events.name: London 5Rhythms with Ajay every Tuesday!
events.description_html:
Come be moved through Gabrielle Roth’s 5Rhythms Waves Map - a dynamic movement practice - with a new 'drop-in class’ in London. The five rhythms - flowing, staccato, chaos, lyrical and stillness. This is where ecstatic dance and meditation meets the dance floor. There are no steps to learn, no right or wrong moves to master. No experience is needed. Every body is welcome. This is a family and child-friendly class. See you next Tuesday!

Ajay Rajani is an accredited teacher of the 5Rhythms who trained with Jonathan Horan, son of Gabrielle Roth, in 2014. Ajay was born in Africa with Indian roots and grew up in London, England where he thrives in a diverse, multicultural community speaking five international languages. His spiritual journey began over a decade ago with a strong practice of seated meditation and this continues to inform his 5Rhythms teaching where he inspires embodying the moment and allowing your body to be your greatest teacher.

*Ajay is a certified and accredited member of the 5Rhythms Teachers Association. All class and workshops hours with Ajay count towards 5Rhythms Teacher Training Waves prerequisites.

Venue: Saint John the Evangelist Church, Kensal Green, 2 Kilburn Lane, London W10 4AA
