On Tuesdays and Saturdays we gather together to dance Gabrielle Roth’s 5Rhythms®. These classes are open to everyone. While it is dancing, it could also be much more. Come along and find out how it might touch your heart or imagination. Move the body and see how it might free the mind. https://www.acalltodance.com

Bring a water bottle and clothes that are comfortable to move in.

People of all ages, sizes and states come; they come alone or with friends, gathering to create a rich and diverse dance floor of adventure and possibility. And you will be welcome - from the most tentative step to the boldest leap.

So, don’t let ideas about yourself or others stop you from coming. Come and find out. You’re not too old or young, too fit or unfit, too able or inhibited, you’re not too special or insignificant. You’re not even too shy!

The class happens twice a week every week.

FIND OUT MORE: https://www.acalltodance.com

What is 5Rhythms®?

Created by Gabrielle Roth and practiced by tens of thousands worldwide, 5Rhythms® is a philosophy, perspective and a dynamic movement practice rooted in the principle that if you put the psyche in motion it will heal itself. Movement is both the medicine and the metaphor, reaching across all languages, cultures and age groups to transform suffering into art, art into awareness, and awareness into action. Wherever the 5Rhythms are practiced, a community is born to dance, to sweat, to change, to support, and to provide a safe space for each of us to shatter the ego’s hold and awaken the juicy, unpredictable, fascinating, edge-walking, rock star part of ourselves that yearns to be free.

The 5Rhythms® are also called a Wave. A Wave of energy and vitality that is different every time, because we are constantly changing. While the Rhythms are universal they move through us via our unique ways of experiencing and expressing ourselves. It's a simple practice, and yet its effects can be powerful and profound.

The rhythms are made up of:
Flowing - calls us through our body, to honour the feminine and arrive in this home called body.
Staccato - calls us through our heart to honour the masculine and the beat of life.
Chaos - calls us through our big mind to let our small mind rest, to let go of what doesn't matter.
Lyrical - calls us through our imagination and helps us lighten up.
Stillness - calls us to compassion.

Sometimes the teacher might lead one Wave in a class, sometimes two or three. Sometimes the Waves are really obvious, sometimes more subtle. As you practice they will start to become a part of your own map of aliveness and you may notice them not just in the dance but in every area of your life. It's a wild and wonderful ride, and beginners are welcome!

As of March 11th, LindyCentral is announcing a hiatus due to the pandemic situation. We will not be hosting any in-person classes or events at this time, but will be offering online classes and challenges. Please follow our facebook page and or website for announcements.

Lindycentral.com

Drop-ins welcome space permitting

7:00pm at ABC Brewery, Harrisburg, PA
Upstairs in the Gallery Room just past the bar.
Drop-ins welcome.
No Partner Needed!
No Experience Necessary!

7:00pm - 8:00pm - Beginner Swing Class - level 1 or level 1.5
7:00pm - 8:00pm - Intermediate Swing /Lindy Class - must know both 6 count and 8 count including the swingout and lindy circle
8:00pm - 9:30pm practice session // socializing // fun!

Welcoming!
Energetic!
Inspiring!
Fun!
Inclusive!
Great people, great dance floor, great music, and great food.
A wonderful way to spend an evening out.

RSVP by noon each day for $5 off your registration at the door.
or
Register soon online to snag the early-bird rate.

We get a lot of questions about "what you have to know and if you need a partner" for these classes. You do not need a partner and you don't need any experience for the Beginner classes.

Most people come solo to the classes. We start with a basic warmup and then move into rhythms and partnering. We advocate for people to rotate partners in classes so you get a chance to practice with everyone and meet lots of people, too. If you are concerned, you can always bring along a few friends to help you feel more comfortable in the classes :)

Learning to dance is a great way to have tons of fun while burning many calories, but a great way to meet people, learn a life skill, and also take care of your brain ;)

If you are not quite ready to join us in the Intermediate session, we encourage you to pop into the Beginner class happening at 7:00pm or possibly look into a private lesson.

More details online at
Lindycentral.com
Can't wait to see you on the dance floor!

Answers to Questions people ask:
Yes, there is a fee for classes. You can save $5 by RSVPing here by noon each class day or earlier if possible. More details on rates on the website
Regular rate is $15 / drop-in per person

No, you truly do not need a partner for our classes.

All students under age 18 must have a guardian present at all times.

We are all ages, but most students are between ages 12 and 90

events.name: 3 Lifestyle Habits that are Wrecking Your Sleep
events.organiser: Women in the Enterprise of Science & Technology
events.description_html:
Getting 4-6 hours of sleep at night is often celebrated in our culture, but more people are starting to wake up to the professional benefits of refreshing, high-quality sleep. Not only does sleep deprivation negatively impact our short-term performance (e.g. focus, decision-making, etc.), it also has severe ramifications for our long-term health (e.g. heart disease, obesity, anxiety & depression). If you’re a professional looking to get the next promotion, help shatter the glass ceiling, or otherwise kick ass at work (while keeping things at home running smoothly), refreshing sleep is a REQUIREMENT for your success and good health.

At least 1 in 3 adults struggle with sleep challenges, and at least half are women. We're women who read articles and blogs, listen to podcasts, buy weighted blankets, and download sleep apps to track and help us sleep. We know what temperature our bedrooms should be, we try to exercise and eat right, we take supplements. Yet many of us STILL have concerns about their nightly sleep & daily energy. It's time for a different perspective: one that helps us understand and address root causes of our sleeplessness.

Participants will learn:

✔ Why natural sleep remedies can actually make things worse
✔ A reason for daytime fatigue that has little to do with your sleep
✔ Why bedtime rituals and "sleep hygiene" techniques often fail to work
✔ Why being "good" with your food all day could be backfiring
✔ How to be "done" with your sleep & energy challenges

To attend the event, you must register here: https://www.westorg.org/2020-04-21-webinar-sleep

events.name: FANTASTIC FUNGI SPECIAL EARTH DAY EVENT
events.organiser: IL Mycological (Mushroom) Assoc: Chicago-based Talks, Forays
events.description_html:
FANTASTIC FUNGI
SPECIAL EARTH DAY EVENT
[masked]

Sign up for free here https://fantasticfungi.com/

As the 50th anniversary of Earth Day approaches, now more than ever, we need to recognize that our connections – to our planet and to one another – can have deep-rooted and long-lasting effects on our lives and our collective future.

On April 21st, we invite you to join us for a virtual gathering featuring live streamed conversations with researchers, educators and solutionaries about our planet’s most pressing environmental and global challenges.

Fungi Day Schedule
10 am PST/1 pm EST:
Educational Forum

We invite parents, teachers and children to watch segments from Fantastic Fungi, where you can explore the mycelial kingdom, and discover how important this amazing world of organisms are to our survival.

Featuring 
William Padilla-Brown, Founder of MicroSymbiotics
Guiliana Furci, Founder of Fundación Fungi
Paul Stamets, Mycologist
Louie Schwartzberg, Filmmaker
Moderated by Stephen Apkon, Filmmaker

1 pm PST/4 pm EST:
Shift in Consciousness

We have to shift our consciousness to gain the perspective we need to bring about change. We have not changed our behavior by reporting the science and the facts. We need to speak to the heart, to understand how we are all connected, because we will protect what we love. 

Featuring 
Jeremy Narby, Anthropologist and Author
Jason Silva, Futurist and Storyteller
Paul Stamets, Mycologist
Louie Schwartzberg, Filmmaker
Francoise Bourzat, Therapist and Author
Moderated by Stephen Apkon, Filmmaker

3 pm PST/6 pm EST:
Nature's Intelligence

Nature knows far more than us. What can we learn from her? All the answers we need lie literally beneath our feet. We need to lose our arrogant human-centric view and learn to live in harmony with the earth. Join us on a deep dive through time and scale to discover the secrets, mysteries and answers that nature can provide.
 
Featuring 
Paul Stamets, Mycologist
Suzanne Simard, Professor of Forest Ecology
Jay Harman, Biomimicry Inventor
Tiokasin Ghosthorse, Activist on Peace, Indigenous and Mother Earth Perspective
Moderated by Louie Schwartzberg, Filmmaker

5 pm PST/8 pm EST:
Female Psychedelic Leaders

Join the many women leading the psychedelic movement to discuss the current challenges and possibilities we face to birth the use of psychedelics during this critical time.  

Featuring 
Pam Kryskow, MD Rural and Family Science
Mary Cosimano, MSW John Hopkins University
Amy Emerson, MD Clinical Research MAPS    
Francoise Bourzat, Therapist and Author
Moderated by Marciana Hale, Therapist and Filmmaker

events.name: Palo Alto Toastmasters Virtual Open House
events.organiser: Palo Alto Toastmasters provides communication and leadership
events.description_html:
Come to Palo Alto Toastmasters’ Virtual Open House...

Palo Alto Toastmasters is holding a Virtual Open House this coming Tuesday, April 21st at noon. Come visit & join in the fun!

Palo Alto Toastmasters is a friendly and diverse group of members who meet weekly for an hour to have fun speaking and connecting. Shy about speaking? We will draw you out with itty bitty jobs and you won’t even realize it’s happening.

We normally meet in the Council Chambers at Palo Alto City Hall. Because we couldn’t bear to be without our meetings, we quickly adapted to an online format which allows us to enjoy each others’ company and also comply with our new social distancing norms.

To join in, please fill out this brief form to receive an invitation to the Open House or our next meeting:

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1ZNINCYsJrNizOSm-Y-Y7CXKrCI_DHckZ3SvbogwMSA0

What to expect at your first visit?

You are more than welcome to participate in the meeting and can volunteer to give a short impromptu speech. You'll also have an opportunity to tell us your impression of the meeting. You may attend our meetings as a guest before you decide to join.

Why join Palo Alto Toastmasters?

• Become a better speaker and presenter, speak with clarity and fluency

• Lose the fear of public speaking in a friendly and supportive environment

• Build community with a diverse group of neighbors

• Learn to speak off the cuff and think on your feet

• Build confidence

• Improve your communication and leadership skills

Guess may attend free of charge. The club is open to all. All speaking levels are welcome in our club.

To join us at the next meeting to see if Palo Alto Toastmasters is right for you, please fill out the brief registration form so we know how to reach you:

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/1ZNINCYsJrNizOSm-Y-Y7CXKrCI_DHckZ3SvbogwMSA0

We look forward to seeing you!

events.name: Google Earth/Zoom Tour of Death Valley
events.organiser: SF Bay Area Geology & Natural Science Hiking Group
events.description_html:
First time went great, so I'm repeating the same tour. This a bit earlier on a Tuesday to see if we have afternoon folks (or evening folks on the East Coast!).

==================
I'm trying something new during these COVID-19 isolation times. No exercise, but plenty of Geology. The group has taken several trips to Death Valley National Park, so I have plenty of photos to show, but our main tour will be via Google Earth.

We'll spend about an hour exploring the northern half of Death Valley. I'll be sharing my screen with everyone, so all you have to do is sit back and watch (or perhaps while on a stairmaster or treadmill???). Primary destinations will be Badwater Basin, Ubehebe Crater, and The Racetack Playa (and we won't wear out our car shocks driving down the washboard road).

Please make sure your Zoom account works before the event. If you don't have a Zoom account, you can create one for free.

At 2:00, I'll post the password in the comments on this page. The link for Zoom from on Meetup page (which shows up only after you RSVP) includes my Meeting ID number. (Keeping the password a bit secret is necessary to keep out 'Zoom bombers.')

Feel free to ask questions or leave suggestions in the comments for this event. If the event goes well, I'll try more in the near future.

If you haven't used Zoom before, it's a program that lets me share my screen with everyone so you can see the tour. It also allows folks to ask questions via the 'chat' section, or the 'raise your hand' button and ask verbally. A good introduction video can be found here: https://youtu.be/9isp3qPeQ0E

The event is free, but I'll have PayPal and Venmo links if you wish to make a donation.

events.description_html:
ONLINE EVENT: As part of its[masked] speaker series, the Scientia Institute at Rice University (https://scientia.rice.edu/panoply), presents "Greening at Home" featuring Rice professors giving brief talks about their research.

Description: "This series of mini lectures deal with the question: What can you do to lower your carbon footprint? Rather than focus on global solutions the speakers talk about what you can do at Rice, in your commute and at your home. Richard Johnson, Rice’s Director of Sustainability, will discuss the important role that students have played in greening their campus home. Lisa Lin, Rice’s Transportation Demand Manager will talk about that thing that all of us dread – the commute – and what we can do to reduce our footprint. Rick Wilson, Political Science, will focus on the design and building of a “green” home and what it means to try to live sustainably in Houston."

Richard Johnson page: https://sustainability.rice.edu/richard-johnson

events.name: Learn how to Increase your mind's potential! Free Meetup class
events.description_html:
Depression, Anxiety, Stress and worry are real concerns when we consider mental health. What causes the overwhelming sadness, the insomnia, the frightening panic attacks, the lack of energy, the mental fatigue and nervousness experienced by so many people.

Even a temporary state of stress can affect our ability to reason and result in actions or decisions that have disastrous long-term results.

What is it that is holding you back and stops you from being YOU?

Quality of life depends so much on mental health. People desire happiness but authentic happiness is often short-lived. Sometimes only a dim memory from childhood. Children are known for their ability to find joy in the simplest of things. What is it that affects a person's ability to experience true happiness?

The Circumstances are the same, but the person no longer responds with positive emotions. Instead he or she may have a persistent gnawing anger, fear or sadness that depresses the consciousness and brings the person to reliance on pills or alcohol.

The change may be gradual, occurring slowly over many years or it can be sudden, triggered by a traumatic stress such as the death of a loved one or a broken heart.

The answer to these problems has been searched for for thousands of years but the problem appears to getting worse, with the rates of depression and suicide climbing alarmingly. Very few lives remain unaffected either directly or indirectly by these modern scourges.

Could it be that the modern "treatments" and "solutions" to these problems are actually making things worse? That could only occur if the people developing and using these "treatments" did not know the true underlying reason for these problems.

Today's meetup topic is based on Dianetics, The Modern Science of Mental Health by L. Ron Hubbard

events.name: Learn how to Increase your mind's potential! Free Meetup class
events.description_html:
Depression, Anxiety, Stress and worry are real concerns when we consider mental health. What causes the overwhelming sadness, the insomnia, the frightening panic attacks, the lack of energy, the mental fatigue and nervousness experienced by so many people.

Even a temporary state of stress can affect our ability to reason and result in actions or decisions that have disastrous long-term results.

What is it that is holding you back and stops you from being YOU?

Quality of life depends so much on mental health. People desire happiness but authentic happiness is often short-lived. Sometimes only a dim memory from childhood. Children are known for their ability to find joy in the simplest of things. What is it that affects a person's ability to experience true happiness?

The Circumstances are the same, but the person no longer responds with positive emotions. Instead he or she may have a persistent gnawing anger, fear or sadness that depresses the consciousness and brings the person to reliance on pills or alcohol.

The change may be gradual, occurring slowly over many years or it can be sudden, triggered by a traumatic stress such as the death of a loved one or a broken heart.

The answer to these problems has been searched for for thousands of years but the problem appears to getting worse, with the rates of depression and suicide climbing alarmingly. Very few lives remain unaffected either directly or indirectly by these modern scourges.

Could it be that the modern "treatments" and "solutions" to these problems are actually making things worse? That could only occur if the people developing and using these "treatments" did not know the true underlying reason for these problems.

events.name: Abstract Algebra(aka Modern Algebra)  Office Hour
events.organiser: Only for the Love of Math!
events.description_html:
The Office Hour is completely on zoom.

What is "office hour"?

1. It is an hour we go over a topic in a subject online. The subjects could be Probability, Machine Learning, Real Analysis, Functional Analysis...etc. You name it.

2. We will go over a single online book/Online course/set of videos in a single subject week after week until we finish it.

3. We will go over it deeply and cover every single topic, back to back.

For this hour of Office hour, we will go cover Abstract Algebra. You can look at the book here:

https://www.luminpdf.com/viewer/5dfae666c1d266001372a12f

Our office hour is small. We are currently in Chapter 1-4. The subject covered so far are groups, and cyclic groups, and all that good stuff. For this book, we typically look at some proves, and problems within the book.

Please, buy a computer pen! It is not going to be a waste of investment when you start doing math online.

events.name: ONLINE Discussion: Coronavirus and the Zeitgeist
events.organiser: Portland Free Philosophy Lectures and Discussions
events.description_html:
Below are this week’s conversational topics: three current tensions related to COVID-19. Each is supported by recent publications. We’ll focus our conversation on these topics, but as always, we’ll aim elsewhere should we find another target of interest.

***

You can watch and listen to previous discussions on youtube: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLB9BS6bIOD28ogYnFlESA70rohzBKS2A5

***

ASSORTED LINKS from 4/14/20 - thanks to those who provided these!

- Edward Snowden on VICE (he calls contact-tracing an “architecture of oppression” and raises many valid concerns)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=k5OAjnveyJo

Follow up. Snowden’s twitter features supporting materials/perspectives: https://twitter.com/Snowden

- Gartner: a variety of economic forecasts for 2020
http://public2.brighttalk.com/resource/core/261800/apr14jlovelock_581760.pdf

- Newsweek: smart-glasses in China that can scan 100s of body temperatures in minutes
https://www.newsweek.com/china-coronavirus-covid19-cases-rokid-smart-glasses-ai-body-temperature-fever-1494481

- The Atlantic: parallels between our moment and France's during the 1780s-90s before the French Revolution
https://www.theatlantic.com/ideas/archive/2020/04/revolution-only-getting-started/609463

- An account of the Carrington Event: a Solar Superstorm that would devastate global informational systems were it to reoccur today; a reminder that we should NOT become complacent about other unlikely but possible existential risks
https://www.history.com/news/a-perfect-solar-superstorm-the-1859-carrington-event

***

DISCUSSION TOPICS, 4/21/20:

(1) When is the right time to re-open the economy?

- https://www.nytimes.com/2020/04/14/upshot/coronavirus-singapore-thinking-big.html

- https://www.huffpost.com/entry/coronavirus-country-reopen-pew_n_5e993099c5b63639081c1ddf

This returns us to a previously discussed tension, which is alive and well here, that lying between human costs and economic costs. Simply put, if we shut down too much of the economy for too long, we may have a substantially damaged economy after the virus passes (Trump’s “the cure is worse than the disease”). While I suspect most of us believe that we should keep the economy closed for now (e.g., see the above HuPo article), the question is: when and how should we reopen? What aspects of the economy should/could be operational during COVID-19? What are the best plans for reopening?

(2) Is globalization in decline?

For:

- https://time.com/5796707/coronavirus-global-economy/

- https://foreignpolicy.com/2020/03/12/coronavirus-killing-globalization-nationalism-protectionism-trump/

Against:

- https://www.japantimes.co.jp/opinion/2020/03/23/commentary/world-commentary/covid-19-wont-kill-globalization/#.XpIvO9NKgUs

(3) Did anti-racist sentiment prevent us from listening to and/or heeding early COVID-19 warnings?

- https://www.theatlantic.com/ideas/archive/2020/03/china-trolling-world-and-avoiding-blame/608332/

(h/t Derwin)

Other examples:

- http://archive.is/fAjXT

- https://www.vox.com/2020/2/7/21126758/coronavirus-xenophobia-racism-china-asians

- https://www.washingtonpost.com/outlook/2020/02/03/why-we-should-be-wary-an-aggressive-government-response-coronavirus/

(h/t Slatestarcodex)

This topic is certainly a part of the zeitgeist surrounding the pandemic. A counter-point: anti-racist sentiments didn't cause us to miss-forecast COVID-19 because there were plenty of other factors that exerted a stronger influence on both our decision making and situational awareness. Examples include poor or inexperienced leadership, a misinformed international news media, interference from the CCP, a desire not to harm the economy, and more. All of these seem valid to me. So, the question is, how harmful should we claim anti-racist sentiments were when accounting for why most of us failed to listen to and/or heed early COVID-19 warnings? 5%? 25%? Why?

A more basic question: why did most of us get this pandemic so tragically wrong?

events.name: Politics Cafe (Online)
events.description_html:
Join us on Zoom to co-create a space for the crucial political conversations that are important in the US 2020 election. Politics Cafe is an ongoing experiment in political discourse leveraging liberating structures, Nonviolent Communication and technology to facilitate crucial political conversations.

Join Zoom Meeting
https://cnvc.zoom.us/j/284356398?pwd=R0JpNU9uRnVlRzgxYmVQbFhlUGhadz09

Meeting ID:[masked]
Password:[masked]
One tap mobile
[masked],,[masked]# US (San Jose)
[masked],,[masked]# US (Houston)

Dial by your location
[masked] US (San Jose)
[masked] US (Houston)
[masked] US (Chicago)
[masked] US (New York)
[masked] US
[masked] US
Meeting ID:[masked]
Find your local number: https://cnvc.zoom.us/u/adH5uDA5gi

Our goal is to facilitate a mutual understanding of key political issues.
We value the following in all our interactions: mutual respect, equal sharing, safety, re-framing the judgments that polarize, openness to all view-points (inclusion).

We use conversational structures to facilitate difficult conversations (LeanCoffee.org, LiberatingStructures.com) and leverage online technology to bring people on different sides of the political spectrum together.

We also leverage Nonviolent Communication (NVC) mediation inspired by Marshall Rosenberg (CNVC.org). As facilitators, we reserve space to step in for conflict mediation in support of our shared goal of mutual understanding. Difficult conversations are expected given the polarity in our current political environment; however, we expect participants to cooperate with facilitators in mediation to transform conflict into understanding.

We assume you agree with the following:
* Consent — you are at choice to participate or not. By participating you consent to mediation if deemed necessary by facilitators.
* Equity — we value and strive for equal time for all participants.
* Free Expression — we are doing the best to express our views which may differ from other participants.
* Emotional Safety — mutual respect is needed for safety. Personal attacks are not allowed.
* Shared Understanding — our goal is to listen and understand, not to change anyone's mind.
* Re-framing Judgments — occasionally, facilitators will invite a re-framing of judgments with curiosity into intrinsic motivations (universal human needs) being expressed.

In the future, we may record and publish short videos that capture part of the conversation. We will get consent for video recording beforehand. These videos will be available online (on YouTube and elsewhere) and can be used by anyone under the most generous Creative Commons license.

Here is the basic structure of our sessions:
* Breathing Exercise/Guided Meditation: Help people settle and allow latecomers to join without having to catch up.
* Check in: Share current emotional state/what’s top of mind for you
* Topics: A list of topics of interest are gathered
* Voting: each participant replies to a poll, selecting the topics of interest to them
* Ordering: topics are ordered by the number of votes received
* Round: go around the room with every person given the opportunity to share
* Empathy (optional): facilitator offers up a reflection of the heart of what was said

Gifts of Money Welcomed: No one turned away for lack of funds (NOTAFLOF): Giving from a sense of "obligation" is toxic to relationships; and I want to offer the opportunity for you to contribute to my livelihood. If you do have resources available, I appreciate receiving money as this is how I support myself. The typical offerings range from $5 to $30 per session. You may send money through PayPal to [masked] (as friend to avoid fees), or thru Venmo @Jaime-Prieto-8. This link has a fee and is quick: https://www.paypal.me/jamesprieto

Enriching lives with laughter? Join us as we clap, breathe, laugh, play, and CREATE JOY!
Practice unconditional laughter,,, WHY? For the fun of it!!! The health of it ,,, And the meeting of beautiful minds and souls.

Improve Mental, Physical, And Spiritual with the power of laughter,

You may want to consider laughing as much as you can!” As part of your routine practice.

Here are just a few of the benefits

Laughter Promotes Good Heart Health
Laughter has been shown to both lower blood pressure and improves blood flow, both of which lead to better cardiovascular health.

Laughter triggers the release of endorphins, the body’s natural feel-good chemicals.
The effects of endorphins in the body have been compared to the effects of drugs such as morphine and codeine, except without any danger of addiction or dependency

Helps to Prevent Cancers
Laughter has been shown to increase the levels of Interferon-Gamma in the body, which in turn promotes the release of B-cells, T-cells, NK cells, and immunoglobulin, and it also helps regulate cell growth.
Not only can all of these things help boost your immune system, they may also help prevent the growth of cancerous cells.

events.organiser: Network with Fashion Industry Professionals & Recruiters
events.description_html:
This is a webinar dedicated to hearing insight about adapting to a new world of business as a result of Covid-19. Our presenter, Kevin Williams, comes from an industry which might be possibly the most negatively affected by the Covid-19, Out-of-Home Entertainment. Kevin will discuss topics that pertain to multiple industries using his expertise on consumer behavior. While discussing lessons in history from previous "Black Swan" events.

MUST RSVP HERE: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/adapting-to-a-post-covid-19-business-world-by-kevin-williams-tickets-102524950888 and you will get Zoom link on confirmation email

Topics/Main-points:
- Lessons on the impact Covid-19 has had on theme parks and leisure entertainment in China

- The new normal of out-of-home entertainment as China slowly reopens

- Lessons learned and borrowed from 2008 financial crisis as it pertains to the "Black Swan" of 2020.

- Short term solutions being used in today's business climate, and how it might impact negatively/positively business in the future.

About the Speaker:
Kevin Williams – a leading specialist in the digital Out-of-Home entertainment industry, through his consultancy KWP Limited, specializing in interactive entertainment. Coming from a long career in the theme park, amusement and entertainment software industries. Well known for his news service, The Stinger Report that has become a-must-read for those working or investing in the international market. Along with this, he is also a prolific writer with regular columns for the main trade publications in this market, along with presenting numerous conference sessions on the sector and its global impact. He is also the co-author of the only book on this aspect of the market, “The Out-of-Home Immersive Entertainment Frontier” – currently working on the next edition for 2021, scheduled for publication soon. Kevin can be reached at [masked].

events.name: Diversity and Inclusion in Fashion (Online Meetup)
events.description_html:
There’s no denying that, in its long and prominent history, the fashion industry has more often than not represented one standard of beauty. From catwalks to advertising campaigns, brands in days past have typically veered towards models of a typical build, age, and ethnicity – but we all know the world is a much richer tapestry. However, in recent years, the industry has been doing more to champion diversity, and we are seeing a much more inclusive approach to representation.

In the previous AFA Fashion Talk we discussed about how Covid-19 will influence Fashion Digital Marketing. During this new online Meetup, we will explore Diversity and Inclusion in Fashion through four talks. As usual, we will start with the presentations by senior students of their academic researches and we will end with the talk by an expert.

1. "The influences of Fashion Trends on Gender Roles", by Sabrina Marinus, 3rd-year student of the BA (Hons) Fashion with Textiles Design.

2. "Cultural Appropriation and Fashion", by Gabriella Frempong, 3rd-year student of the BA (Hons) Fashion with Textiles Design.

3. "Gender Neutral Fashion, Is There a Future?", by Quirine Galavazi, 3rd-year student of the BA (Hons) Fashion with Textiles Design.

4. "Perspectives on Diversity and Inclusion in the Fashion Industry", by Giancarlo Pazzanese, lecturer of the Amsterdam Fashion Academy.

At the end of the four talks, you will have the opportunity to ask questions to the panelists.

Please, click on the link to register: https://luiss.webex.com/luiss/onstage/g.php?MTID=e017282e03b498828e710cbb1cc96c5ba

This Online Meetup has no costs. Feel free to invite guests!

Direct where you place your awareness and how.

MOVIES AND DOCUMENTARIES

MAX PLANCK one of the greatest minds.

ALBERT EINSTEIN

NIKOLA TESLA

Is it a love story? RM

While we may love each other and never stop loving
each other, so often we stop "showing" each
other love.
Lisa Nichols

They can only forgive and embrace you to the capacity that they are able to forgive and embrace themselves. They can only give you what they have the capacity to give. You may think that you deserve more, and you may be correct. But that means nothing if a person simply doesn’t have the ability to give it to you.
Lisa Nichols,

Sent from my iPhone

events.name: FYI: Fashion Revolution LIVE Q&A on YouTube!
events.description_html:
Hello everyone!

I’m ONLY sharing NOT hosting!

Because we love secondhand style, I’m guessing that many of us are aware of the Fashion Revolution movement. Fashion Revolution aims to bring awareness and action to important social and environmental issues around fashion. April 20 - 26 is supposed to be the official FR week, but because of the global virus we are facing, many events have been put on line.

One of those events is a LIVE YouTube discussion on Friday, April 24 11:00-13:00 BST (I believe that is noon Zürich time) The title of the talk is:

Mass Consumption: The End of an Era?

“focus on the topic of mass production and consumption and its impact on our planet and the people who make our clothes.”

You can find access to the event through the Fashion Revolution YouTube channel. I think it will be a really interesting talk! You can find other events and lots of good information on their Instagram account and through their main site:

https://www.fashionrevolution.org

Again, I’m not hosting this. I’m merely using this planner to share all the info. Be sure to check out Fashion Revolution on Instagram, YouTube and their website for lots of good info!

I hope you are all well :)

We will chat again soon,
Elianne

events.name: Stash busting sewalong, step 4: sewing up!
events.description_html:
If you're still with me on using a stash fabric or just want general support of your current sewing project here's the last part of this sewlong: sew it up!

If you finished your item long ago, how about making another one? The more of our stash fabrics we get through, the more experience we gain and the more satisfying the sewing process can become.

I must admit that I have not yet started the navy/cream velvet top I want to make - and that's because I am not sure that I picked a suitable pattern. I did start a sleeveless blouse with a different stash fabric (nothing to do with the velvet project just because I got the sudden urge). And I started a toile out of a newly bought and very cheap black jersey so I can evaluate the Lekala pattern I was going to use for my precious velvet. I also used a grey jersey fabric from my stash for a simple raglan sleeved top and now wonder if that mightn't be the best pattern for the velvet?

Every practical bit that I get to do teaches me what works and what doesn't. Unfortunately I often stop at the stage of "oh crikey I've run into a problem" and never picked the project back up. That gets very frustrating. It makes such a nice change this time: I threw myself into sewing with any fabric and any pattern that mysteriously made its way onto my sewing table. I will tackle the velvet, I promise!

What are you making, what kinds of stash fabric have you used recently and which do you think you might use next? Pictures please!

events.name: Online/Virtual SPEED DATING (30s & 40s) NY Tri-State
events.description_html:
*REGISTER - https://www.weekenddating.com/event-details.aspx?id=7638#tix (our last one sold out quickly so if you'd like participate, please register ASAP)

Meet singles from the safety and comfort of your own home. This event is for Ages 30s & 40s who live or work in NY Tri-State area.

You will meet singles via your computer with webcam or smartphone/tablet (strong WiFi connection required if using a phone). The event will take place in a Virtual Room using Zoom (Zoom is a free download and super easy to use).

HOW DOES IT WORK?
We will break participants into pairs of two, just like we do with traditional speed dating. You will get to speak to each dates for a specified amount of time (typically 4-6 minutes). After the specified number of minutes, the guys will rotate to the next date and the process continues.

Just like with traditional speed dating, at the end of the event you will be able to let us know who you were interested in. We will send you both mutual matches (you picked them and they picked you) as well as one way matches (they picked you but you did not pick them).

You are given 20 minutes from the end of the event to let us know who you are interested in and will receive the results the same night (usually within one hour) or the next morning. You will not have to wait 24 hours or more to get your results.

The minimum number of potential dates will be 5 and the maximum will be about 10. If there are less than 5 members of the opposite sex in attendance, you would get credit for a future Virtual event.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
How do I find the Virtual/Zoom Room?
After you purchase your ticket, you will get a confirmation appear on your screen along with the Zoom link for you to use to log in.

*To attend, get ticket at - https://www.weekenddating.com/event-details.aspx?id=7638#tix

*Cost is between $20-$25 depending on how early you register.

events.name: Virtual TIGER KING Trivia/Fundraiser Night
events.description_html:
*REGISTER - https://www.socialevents123.com/event-details.aspx?id=7607 (Limited Number: Save $$ by using the discount code: VIRTUAL. A portion of sales will go to groups providing meals/support (ie. Huntington Meals) to those working on the front lines.)

Hey all you cool cats and kittens! Think you know the most about Tiger King? Join the zoo and test your knowledge about Netflix's hottest show! You could be walking away with all of your limbs and a tasty Amazon gift card!

Attend via computer/webcam or Smartphone/IPad/Tablet. This completely online event will be LIVE and you will be able to see and hear the other participants while playing. In addition you get to meet and interact with other participants.

You can have more than 1 person on your team as long as they're from your house and use same device. Friends/family around the country can also play. They would just need to also register for a ticket. After you register, you will get a confirmation with a secured Zoom link for you to use to log in.

At game time, your host will read off Tiger King Trivia questions. Your goal is to come up with the right answer to each question and write it down on your paper. Once the round is over, we will go through the answers and determine who had the highest score for the round. They will get a raffle ticket for a chance to win a prize at the end of the event. We will have multiple rounds of play and have a system to also virtually introduce you to other participants.

RSVPS ON HERE ARE NOT REFLECTIVE OF ACTUAL ATTENDANCE as this is a multi group event. Cost: $10.99- $20 depending on how early you register.

*P.S. Event organizers are being hit especially hard right now. We are working hard to create fun virtual events for you to participate and meet/make new friends. We appreciate your support during this trying time.

events.name: METABOLIC-CON: Optimize Your Metabolism to Stay Healthy & Immune Strong!
events.organiser: Contest Prep Co-op for Figure, Fitness & Bikini Competitors
events.description_html:
In the wake of this viral pandemic, staying healthy is top of mind for most everyone I know. Vitamins are flying off of store shelves. Internet searches for immune-boosting tips have increased.

Questions abound. But finding the right answers can be overwhelming. There’s just so much information being thrown at us.

And that’s EXACTLY why I’m so excited to share this with you…

Now there’s just one place to find solutions you seek. Over 30 health experts have come together to share their best advice on how to keep your immune system in tip top shape... which also happens to get your body looking and feeling great, too!

So come join us at Metabolic-Con: Optimize Your Metabolism To Stay Healthy And Immune Strong!

What is Metabolic-Con, anyhow?

It’s a FREE online conference which I'm hosting from April 21st to April 30th, 2020. The event features interviews and presentations provided by leading doctors and health professionals to help you overcome fatigue, shed excess weight, optimize your immune system, and of course, help you live a happier and healthier life!

Here are just some of the topics we’ll be discussing in this event:

- Exercising for optimal metabolism and immune function.
- Improving your immune and hormonal health through a home detox.
- How to get the energy you need, whenever you want it.
- Foods that may be sabotaging your metabolism.

And so much more!

After participating in Metabolic-Con, you’ll have the information you need to put you on the path to a healthier and happier self.

We are so excited for you to join us – and because you are a valued member of my Meetup community, I have saved you a FREE virtual seat.

There is absolutely NOTHING that should stop you from getting the body you want and the health you seek. With the right knowledge, you can achieve it! So join us at Metabolic-Con. Once you RSVP Yes, I'll message you the registration form for FREE access.

I hope to see you there!
-Dr. Venus

P.S. I'm also going to throw in a FREE copy of my "Quick Start Guide To Be Immune Strong" when you register for Metabolic-Con! These simple steps can transform your health by optimizing your immune system. So take that first step to becoming your very best today. Register now for FREE. I'll message you the registration form once you RSVP Yes.

events.name: [ONLINE] Qigong Wellness - Home Edition (Shinsei Way) @ 10:00 am
events.description_html:
Shinsei/Qigong develops and promotes wellness through gentle breathing and moving exercises, meditation and facilitated discussion. Improve your health, reduce your stress, and enrich your life.

During this time of COVID-19 physical distancing and home sequestering, William will be providing an armchair edition of Qigong with a basic introduction to this ancient practice, some simple movements you can learn to do at home, meditation moments and an opportunity for Q&A.

DATE/TIME: Every Tuesday & Thursday @ 10:00 AM

ZOOM ONLINE: From the comfort of your own space, click the link in the white box to the right of this paragraph (after you've RSVPed) to join the video conference on your phone, tablet or PC.

FACEBOOK LIVE: Tune-in to the live video stream and follow along (or view previous sessions) at our Facebook page https://www.facebook.com/creatingconnectioncanada/live

DIAL-IN AUDIO: Can't do video? Just dial-in from your home/cell phone and punch in the meeting ID below.

Phone Number:[masked]
Meeting ID: From the link in the white box to the right of this paragraph.

Hope to see you there. Here's to your health!

NOTE: The RSVPs here represent only partial list of attendees as this event is advertised in many different places.

ABOUT QIGONG & THE SHINSEI WAY

Shinsei is about change. It is a Japanese word signifying rebirth, starting over, and renewing one’s self. This unique program helps develop healthier, happier, and more satisfying lifestyles in a congenial and professional setting. Learn to control and manage the negative stress and lifestyle issues that damage our lives.

These classes are designed to take you from introductory to more involved levels as you develop your practice creating a more positive, energized and relaxed focus to life and living.

ABOUT CREATING CONNECTION CANADA

Creating Connection is a network of welcoming and inclusive communities committed to sharing in authentic conversation, promoting meaningful activities and fostering holistic wellness practices. We are LGBTQ+ affirming.

Please visit our Products 4 Purpose online store (http://www.products4purpose.ca) to make a purchase (or leave a donation) that benefits our meaningful partner organizations, gifted artisans and local operations. Your support is gratefully appreciated!

Creating Connection Canada
Website: https://www.creatingconnection.ca/
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/creatingconnectioncanada/
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/creatingconnexion/

WEEKEND RETREATS

Do you long for deeper, more meaningful connection? Then consider attending one of our weekend retreats. Experience workshops, presentations, holistic wellness practices and other activities that help explore the inner self while connecting externally with others, the world around us and the divine.

events.organiser: EAST BAY RAW: Raw & Vegan Food & Health
events.description_html:
Why Haven't We Heard this Before? The Truth about Nutrition and COVID-19. Dr. Michael Klaper & Nelson Campbell on The Power of Diet in Viral Response: Join the Global Jumpstart!

April 21,[masked]:00 AM PST

Description
Dr. Michael Klaper, director of the Moving Medicine Forward Initiative (MMF), and Nelson Campbell, founder of the nonprofit PlantPure Communities, will discuss the recent important commentary (https://plantpurecommunities.org/defense-against-covid-19/) by Dr. T. Colin Campbell, on the role of a whole food, plant-based (WFPB) diet in viral response. The discussion will also provide valuable information to participants in the Global 10-Day Jumpstart to Flatten the Curve Through Nutrition, (kick-off April 19th). Their far-ranging conversation will cover the various health benefits of eating a plant-based diet from a medical perspective. Importantly, they will speak to the reason why many of us, and our doctors, are unaware of the healing power of food. To this end, Dr. Klaper will also discuss the Moving Medicine Forward Initiative, which seeks to bring the revolutionary ideas of disease reversal through plant-based nutrition and lifestyle medicine to medical schools across the country. These two visionary leaders will be sharing ideas and information that is particularly timely during the COVID-19 pandemic.

You’re invited to join the discussion!
https://zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_63XfCuPBSzi3nxyqUJHpJw

events.name: Earth Day 50 Year Celebration: Grounding with Mother Earth
events.description_html:
Let's celebrate Mother Earth by grounding with her in Mind/Body/Spirit. April 22 is the 50 Year Celebration, and the theme for Earth Day 2020 is Climate Action.
Join me for this online workshop to learn how to use Grounding, also called Earthing, to help you neutralize stress and feel balanced, safe and connected. We'll discuss the history and vision of Earth Day. We'll practice some grounding techniques that you can use at home every day for free! I'll lead you through a guided grounding meditation, and you will feel relaxed and uplifted during these challenging times.
Mother Earth gives us so much--let's honor her together on the day before Earth Day--and every day!

This a virtual business and social networking happy hour event via live video to give business professionals the opportunity to connect screen to screen with one another and exchange ideas and have fun while learning about sushi.

Most of us know exactly what to eat to be healthy... but FEW of us know how to actually STOP over-eating & over-snacking!! With the quarantine not letting up anytime soon, now is THE time to solve this over-eating problem once and for all!

events.name: Cooking with an Instant Pot - Steamed Cod with Ginger Garlic Broth & Bok Choy
events.description_html:
<< UPDATE: This workshop will be done VIRTUALLY! I will be doing a LIVE STREAM in The Emerald City VIP Community Facebook Group!

Use this link and request to join. I'll make sure you get added right away! https://www.facebook.com/groups/563649994452723/ >>

I love this Instant Pot fish recipe because it's so easy to make, and it comes out perfect every time! Real talk, I could eat a meal like this almost every night.

The Instant Pot can indeed make some delicate, perfectly steamed, flaky fish - you just have to know what you're doing.

In this month's Instant Chef VIRTUAL meet-up, I will be demonstrating this recipe, so you can cook fish in the Instant Pot like a champ. You'll never have to eat rubbery fish ever again.

You can totally make this dish, walk away while it's cooking, and come back to a healthy meal that everyone's sure to love.

Who said eating well had to be hard work?

I hope you'll join me and other fellow Instant Chefs for this fun VIRTUAL workshop!

- Christine

events.name: Understanding Cholesterol
events.description_html:
Watch this short video: https://youtu.be/cZXZj6-5HNs

Heart disease is the #1 killer in the U.S. And, one of the leading risk factors is elevated cholesterol. In fact, one of the most prescribed group of medications are for managing elevated cholesterol. But, exactly what IS cholesterol? Research shows that lifestyle changes can drasticlly improve cholesterol levels and decrease cardiovascular disease risk better than medications.

You will learn:
> How elevated cholesterol contributes to increased cardiovascular disease risk.
> What cholesterol really is. (Most people don't know)
> Six important lifestyle steps to reduce cholesterol.
> Cutting edge research on the best reduction of cardiovascular disease risk.

Register online:
https://zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_Ftyg2oIkRwiE91U7izaMCA

Ruben J Guzman, MPH, LMP, is the author of Evolving Health and living proof of what it takes to lose weight, eat healthy and stay fit. Ruben possesses over 30 years of experience in the health field: attended 3 years at the UC Davis School of Medicine, Master’s degree in Public Health from UCLA specializing in behavioral sciences/health promotion, and is a Board Certified Lifestyle Medicine Professional from the American College of Lifestyle Medicine. Having gone through his own health challenge and then losing 50+ pounds in 1995, Coach Ruben provides a living demonstration of what it takes to enjoy a lifestyle filled with energy, vitality and productivity. He has kept the weight off for more than 20 years and has taught hundreds to do the same. He lowered his cholesterol from 270 to 136. For more information, visit https://www.coachruben.com/free-seminar-schedule/

events.name: Brindlewood Bay: Episode 1
events.organiser: House Rules: Tabletop Gaming in Your Neighbors' Homes
events.description_html:
BRINDLEWOOD BAY is a roleplaying game about a group of elderly women — members of the local Murder Mavens mystery book club — who frequently find themselves investigating (and solving!) real-life murder mysteries. Over the course of their investigations, the Mavens uncover supernatural forces that are taking hold of their small coastal community.

The game is directly inspired by the television show Murder, She
Wrote, but also takes inspiration from the works of H.P. Lovecraft, “cozy”
crime dramas, and American TV shows from the ‘70s, ‘80s, and ‘90s.

NOTE: Players are encouraged to AVOID reading up on the game, as spoilers abound! Brindlewood Bad is a very simple game to learn, so prep is actively discouraged!

* * * * *

EVENT NOTES

This will the first session in a short (3-6 game) campaign. Games will be held on Tuesday mornings.

This is an all-ages game.

We will play through Zoom. The link and password will be sent to attendees before the game begins.

events.name: Tuesday 1:00pm Online
events.description_html:
Due to the Covid-19 issue, we are meeting online til further notice. see the link in the comments section or email me (Sue) for the link.

****************************

We meet and play Mah Jongg here at 1:00PM every Tuesday unless a message is posted otherwise.

We are a friendly group of ladies and welcome experienced, players. We use NMJL rules with some Tournament rules as well, but no House rules, and most of our players play a 15 minute game. If you are brand new to Mahjongg we can provide you with a list of locations to play and get your "sea legs" before coming. Most of our players have been playing for 6 months or more, weekly.

Due to several players having allergies: PLEASE DO NOT WEAR ANY FRAGRANCES, such as perfumes or powders.

YOU MUST rsvp YES to come. We cannot accommodate "drop ins" - we depend on this RSVP system to know how many tables and games we need to have set up. I do NOT check my phone or emails for last minute changes.

Thanks everyone for your cooperation! It's what makes our group a great one!

Sue

events.name: Online Creative Collage- 5th-9th Graders - Tuesday April 21st
events.description_html:
Join us for Online Creative Collage Night from the comfort of your own home.

Meredith Newman, will lead an evening of fun creative collage using your own personal touch with nothing but paper, tape or a glue stick! Join us for a fun evening of open creativity. Create a collage about what brings you joy or hope...or just do your own theme! No experience necessary just the willingness to play and have fun! We'll be chatting along the way!

Gather paper of any kind - magazines, wrapping paper, comics. newspapers, your own doodles, or even catalogs from the mail along with a glue stick or tape, scissors and a large piece of paper or cardboard to use as a base.

Once registered you will be able to click the zoom link from this meetup page and join the Zoom meeting with your webcam or microphone (even your cell phone). If you prefer, just watch and listen. You do not have to have a Zoom account to participate. We have that covered! This is one of our first online gatherings so we'll work out the kinks and have fun doing it. See you there!

PLEASE - If you've never used Zoom before, watch the following video for some basic skills to help you join us!
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hIkCmbvAHQQ

This an all gatherings are free during COVID-19 crisis. This and all Nest Gatherings are FREE during this pandemic. If you'd like to support The Nest go to https://nestcoffeehouse.square.site and check out our online shop. You can even make a donation if you would like! Thank you!

events.name: #1-12 {2e}: The Burden of Envy (1-4)
events.organiser: Pathfinder and Starfinder Society of Baltimore, MD
events.description_html:
A Pathfinder Society Scenario designed for levels 1–4 (subtiers 1–2 and 3–4).

Swindler, rogue, and occasional Pathfinder ally Guaril Karela has approached the Society with an opportunity that Valais Durant, the leader of the Society's Radiant Oath faction, can't refuse. Guaril has been charging refugees to sneak them out of Xin Edasseril, a city ruled by the Runelord of Envy, and now it looks like Guaril won't be able to fulfill his contracts. Society agents are charged with sneaking into the dangerous city and sneaking out with a handful of its citizens before their absence is noticed so that the Radiant Oath can help them find new lives beyond their current ruler's tyrannical reach.

Written by: Lysle Kapp

This will be online, with maps and rolls via Roll20, voice chat through Discord. Links available for those who RSVP.

Campaign Overview
Welcome to Baldur's Gate, a city of ambition and corruption. You’ve just started your adventuring career, but already find yourself embroiled in a plot that sprawls from the shadows of Baldur's Gate to the front lines of the planes-spanning Blood War! Do you have what it takes to turn infernal war machines and nefarious contracts against the archdevil Zariel and her diabolical hordes? events.name: Falling Floors 5E Homebrew Campaign
events.description_html:
This campaign is a D&D campaign based on the 5e rules and uses an online character creator know as DnD Beyond.

The campaign description:

"Life was normal for a while, until one day magic cracks, shudders, and bends. Something big is happening and its sending ripples of disturbance into your reality. As the conditions get worse people are sent to figure out what the source is. Eventually the location is determined and they need adventurers to venture out and stop it. Can you survive a trip to Hell?"

Falling Floors is an exploration and role play focused game that progressively ramps up difficulty allowing for new players to adapt and gain experience with their characters.

It would be preferred if you joined the D&D Beyond campaign https://ddb.ac/campaigns/join/7282721351151025 as it would allow easy character creation for new players, this is not necessary to start.

For more updates and help with character creation you can join the Falling Floors Discord Server https://discord.gg/Stp2TA4.

Due to the fact that D&D beyond is digital you should bring a laptop or a phone.

Inexperienced players welcome!

events.name: Weekly Open Roleplaying
events.description_html:
Here are the games being run this session. If you are new to the group or interested in joining, feel free to come down and check us out. We should be able to find a game for you.

Hatred's Heart (NEW!)
Rules: 7th ed. Call of Cthulhu
GM: Kevin Christensen

A group of intrepid investigators embark upon a globetrotting campaign to defeat an evil cult, with origins in German mysticism and the Druids.

Crystals and Shifters and Magic, oh my! (NEW!)
Rules: The system is a mash up of World of Darkness, Cavemaster (a non dice based system), and a home brewed magic system.
GM: Ingrid Stark

In a world of elemental magic, each of the Shifter Clans works with one of the Four Elements of Magic.

Sweet Song of Far Realm (continuing)
Rules: 2nd Edition AD&D
GM: Richard Barton

With the Aboleth's plans thwarted, heroes are sought out. Chaos still has a strangle-hold on the world of Segmenta.

The Rising Knight (continuing)
Rules: Castles & Crusades
GM: Brian Cerridwen

The Red Caps, a goblin advanced element of Unguaith Kine’s army has been defeated, can the Adventurers locate Kine’s base and end a war before it begins?

Have You Seen This Pooka? (continuing)
Rules: World of Darkness / Cyberpunk 2020 cross over using the Storyteller system
GM: Bob Collier

The World of Darkness has grown even colder as the decades have crawled on.

Hot Springs Island (continuing)
Rules: Variant of the Black Hack
GM: Colin Conn

Blood Beard has claimed Hot Springs Island for all Rogue Traders, free from the corporatism of the Martel Company and our adventurers are caught in the middle of it!

Where is Arbalest and Why Am I In This Handbasket? (continuing)
Rules: Original 1st Edition AD&D - 3rd-4th level
GM: John E. Peck

Pity poor Arbalest! The village has lost its namesake crossbow and the burgher mistress' newborn baby has been kidnapped by a band of ruffians - plus the town's hero has gone missing and is perhaps succumbing to lycanthropy?

events.name: Online Gaming: Just One party game
events.organiser: Here Be Books & Games Board Game Meetup
events.description_html:
We'll be playing via the Web Ex by Cisco app. Just One is a cooperative party game in which you play together to discover as many mystery words as possible. Find the best clue to help your teammate. Be unique, as all identical clues will be cancelled!

A complete game is played over 13 cards. The goal is to get a score as close to 13 as possible. In case of a right answer, the players score 1 point. In case of wrong answer, they lose the current card as well as the top card of the deck. Thus losing 2 points. In case of lack of answer, the players only lose the current card, and therefore only 1 point.

You have the choice – make the difference! 3 to 7 players ages 8 and up can play Just One in about 20 minutes.

Web Ex by Cisco is an easy-to-use video conferencing app available for iOS and Android phones and tablets, as well as for desktop computers. You can download it from webex.com by clicking the Start for Free button.

If you want to try a test run of Web Ex before the games start, call Tina at (843)[masked].

Meeting URL: https://meetingsamer10.webex.com/meet/hbbng

Looking forward to seeing your smiling faces and gaming with you again! Please RSVP now.

#HereBeBooksAndGames #gaming #tabletopgaming #JustOne

events.name: Raygun Lounge 2020:  D&D 5e Open game for Beginners
events.organiser: The Seattle Dungeons & Dragons and RPG Meetup Group
events.description_html:
Let's play D&D online! I will be running a short adventure (1 or 2 sessions) starting at level 1 over Discord.

You can follow the link to my own server is below. Discord is free and relatively easy to use. Please feel free to message me if you have any questions about creating a Discord account. I'll be assigning roles, to simplify the process for everyone and cut down on the number of channels you have to navigate.

** I have a standard bot for dice rolling, but I am also using Avrae, which will integrate character info for those who use Dnd Beyond, and much more. I'll also have pregenerated character PDFs for anyone not deciding what to play beforehand. Please see links below for pregenerated character sheets **

This is part of but somewhat separate from the usual weekly Tuesday events, but most of the rules still apply! See boilerplate below;

We will be managing the RSVP/Wait List in favor of new players over players who have been with us for over 1 year AND/OR players attending other weekly D&D 5e public play games. If you're a visitor to our Emerald City, let us know, you may get a jump on the Wait List! Ideally, in that year, you'll learn the game basics, make some friends, and find a home group.

**Be sure you have your Profile set to alert you when you're confirmed for an event and respond to messages from the Event Organizers.**

Games may be with mixed leveled characters, so a first time player with a level 1 character may sit next to a level 3 character. Play accordingly; hang back if you're weaker, protect your comrades if you're stronger. Decide if your party needs to fight, run, bully, bribe, or beg your way through the game.

We are looking for Heroic Adventurers, so leave your evil, chaotic, solo, or morally questionable characters for your home game.

You can find some premade characters here:
http://dnd.wizards.com/articles/features/character_sheets
http://www.fastcharacter.com/

Or you can build your own character using the standard set numbers (15, 14, 13, 12, 10, 8) or point buy on page 13 in the Players Handbook. Take max HP when creating and leveling up. You may use any material from the WotC published books, but no homebrew material, online content, or custom material. It's okay to bring several characters of various levels since you never know what table you'll play. We will be happy to sit and build a character with you AFTER the game since that can take 30-60 minutes.

Fighters and Rogues are easier for new players to use to learn game basics. If you're playing a Spellcaster, you should bring your spell details on index cards, photocopies, or a digital spellbook (Fight Club 5th Edition by Lion's Den is a decent app), cell phones and tablets are okay to use but leave your laptops at home due to space limitations.

We technically start at 6:30 but I want to add a 30-minute buffer to go over things for anyone new to Discord itself or role-playing on Discord.

Please keep your RSVP up to date. If you're on the Wait List and make other plans, be sure to change your RSVP. If you No Show us, you might get removed from future events. Be aware that Meetup sometimes has a delay on their notifications, so BE SURE to check your Wait List status on the app or website.

Our tables are positive, friendly, and welcoming spaces for all adventurers, regardless of class, race, gender, or sexual identity. Any negativity fueled by real-world ignorance, hate, or fear will be met with swift action and possible permanent teleportation to the plane of eternal banishment.

We are NOT an official Adv League event, so we don't issue/track XP, items, rewards, etc.

events.name: Coping with COVID-19 Isolation and Anxiety
events.organiser: Gender Services: Inclusive LGBTQIA+ Support Groups
events.description_html:
Connect with us on Zoom for our WEEKLY lunch-time support group focused on staying calm and maintaining self-care during this time of social distancing.

A suggested agenda for the group:

1) Introductions and share - checking in about what stressors are affecting you during this time with your relationships, work and social lives.

2) Share examples of coping strategies that help get through difficult times.

We will discuss mindfulness techniques to decrease anxiety and increase calmness.

3) Share one or more things for which you are grateful in this moment to help build resilience and recognize our unique strengths.

Open to all ages 18 and over.

Zoom link will be posted for this ONLINE event.

events.name: BUTTCAMP Live with The Muscle Marys
events.organiser: The Muscle Marys  - London Gay Group Fitness
events.description_html:
Coronavirus will not stop us!

We are pleased to announce that we are continuing to run our weekly timetable of our amazing classes online via INSTAGRAM Live!

Join us for Buttcamp Live!

Do you dread leg day? Now you don't have to! With The Muscle Marys' weekly class, ButtCamp - a bootcamp focusing on, you guessed it, the BUTT - leg day has never been this sexy or fun. It's just the workout you need to get your heart rate going in the privacy of your own home while still feeling part of the community!

All our sessions include warm-up, strengthening exercises and a strong focus on correct techniques and postures to avoid injury and most importantly, how to work out effectively and safely.

They are designed to be suitable for any LGBTQ+ person of any age (over 18) and all levels, so no prior gym experience needed.

HOW TO JOIN:
Simply follow The Muscle Marys on Instagram, go to our page click on the stories at the time the workout starts, and you will see us LIVE.

WHAT TO WEAR:
Wear whatever you feel happy about as long as it doesn’t impede your movement and ability to get your sweat on!
Make sure you wear good footwear though.

Don’t forget to have a towel and a bottle of water close by!

Remember to always stay Proud and see you on Tuesday!

🏳️‍🌈

Mark
The Muscle Marys
www.themusclemarys.co.uk
[masked]
https://www.facebook.com/TheMuscleMarys/
https://www.instagram.com/themusclemarys/
https://www.meetup.com/theMuscleMarys/

events.name: Netflix Party: THE MONEY PIT
events.description_html:
Join us for our next virtual "Netflix n' Chill" night:

THE MONEY PIT
a Netflix Party*

This 1986 comedy gem stars TOM HANKS, before he was a serious Oscar-winning actor. It also stars SHELLEY LONG, a popular 80's comedy actress.

It's very easy to do, just follow these steps:

1. Download the free Netflix party CHROME EXTENSION** here, available on PC, iPhone, Android, and Mac: https://www.netflixparty.com/

2. Come back here at 6:45pm, before the movie airs at 7pm, and click this link to enter our party and the RED "NP " icon on your browser to open the chat window

LINK: Coming Thursday 6:45pm

3. Sit back and enjoy the show. There's a live CHAT ROOM feature on the right side of your screen, feel free to comment or chat anytime during the film!

Hope you all can make it, and we appreciate your patience and continued support through these trying and crazy times. We can't do 'em without YOU :-)

*You must have a Netflix subscription to participate in this event

SYNOPSIS:
Young lovers Walter (Tom Hanks) and Anna (Shelley Long) are house-sitting the New York City apartment owned by Max (Alexander Godunov), Anna's ex-husband, who suddenly decides to toss them out. Needing a new home, they settle on buying a country estate outside the city, which is available for a suspiciously low price. It soon becomes apparent why, as doors fall off their hinges, staircases come tumbling down and a bathtub falls through the floor. The couple's relationship suffers similarly.

events.name: Virtual BSO: Beethoven, Tchaikovsky, and Wine (BYO)
events.organiser: Boston Gay Men's Fine Arts Coterie
events.description_html:
Hey everyone!

I hope everyone is surviving both the virus and the self-isolation okay. I'm pretty sick of my four walls, but all things considered, I can't complain.

Anyway, let's "socialize distantly" and meet on Zoom, catch up, watch some BSO on Youtube, and drink some wine (or whatever you want).

The Programme:

7:00 Meet and re-greet from your living room. Go to:
https://mit.zoom.us/j/98466649750?pwd=R09BTU1KUVR0U0lBZXRYbENPaFJxdz09

(Zoom will ask you whether you want to watch online or download the app; either should be fine. The free version of Zoom allows for only 40 minutes for large-group meetings, but my work (MIT) has a site license, so I can, er, go longer. Ahem.)

Shortly before 7:00, I will send a password to those who have RSVP'ed.

Then we'll watch two old concert films with a young Seiji Ozawa conducting:

7:15 Beethoven Violin Concerto with Anna Sophie Von Mutter (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PbZGrKge59E&t=1020s)

8:00 Intermission -- Discuss convivially.

8:15 Tchikovsky Piano Concerto #1 with Evgeny Kissin (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dXLKjE-vyoo&t=1603s)

I look forward to v-seeing you!

events.description_html:
We get together every 1st and 3rd Tuesday of the month over video chat on Zoom to discuss topics specific to the bi+ community. Come join us in a safe, accepting environment and help build a stronger bi+ community in the Bay Area. Hope to see you there.

Join the meeting on Zoom: https://zoom.us/join
Meeting ID:[masked]
Password:[masked]
Please update your display name to include your name and pronouns!

Optional:
- Download Zoom on your computer or phone. You can also join through your computer's browser without having to download anything.
- Create an account for free. You do not need to pay anything. You can join a meeting without an account.

Please do not go to the Billy DeFrank Center because we will not be there.

-------
DISCORD
If you want to socialize during non-meeting times, join our Discord server!

INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Discord is a free online platform. You can use it directly in your browser at https://discordapp.com/ or download the app on your laptop or phone.
2. Create a Discord profile.
3. Message me (Ailee) and I will give you a temporary link to our server that will expire after one day. Please do not share this link with anyone.*
4. Use the link to join our server.
5. Read the #rules channel at the top of the server.
6. Chat with other bi+ people.

*We want to keep our server for members of this group for now. If you know of someone who wants to join our group and they aren't on Meetup, message me.

events.name: MAX Goes to the Opera Online: The Exterminating Angel
events.organiser: MAX SF | A social community for gay men and their friends.
events.description_html:
** IMPORTANT: THIS POSTING IS FOR INFORMATION ONLY. IF YOU WISH TO PARTICIPATE IN THIS EVENT, YOU MUST PROVIDE YOUR EMAIL ADDRESS BY REGISTERING FOR FREE AT https://bit.ly/2ynLOM2 **

During this time of social distancing, we're trying something new at MAX -- virtual shared performing arts events!

For the second MAX virtual performing arts event, we're going to watch the New York Metropolitan Opera production of "The Exterminating Angel".

Join co-champions Bruce Cecil and Michael Meehan online on Tuesday, April 21st, from 7:00pm to 8:30pm, to discuss this performance.
"The Exterminating Angel" is a modern (2016) English-language opera by Thomas Adès.

The New York Times reviewer wrote in 2017 "If you see one opera this year, make it The Exterminating Angel". Read the New York Times review at https://nyti.ms/2R7NMqv

As the opera opens, a group of elegant socialites gather for a lavish dinner party, but when it is time to leave, no one is able to escape. As the days pass, their behavior becomes increasingly erratic and savage. The large ensemble cast tackles both the vocal and dramatic demands of Adès's score with one riveting performance after another. Tom Cairns directs an engrossing and inventive production, using a towering wooden archway to trap the characters onstage. Adès himself takes the podium to conduct the frenzied score.

This emotionally thrilling opera provides fertile ground for conversation: the possible meanings of this surrealistic extravaganza and the relationship to our own lives in which we are all now trapped in our own restrictive environments, day after day, week after week.

"The Exterminating Angel" is available online from The Met Opera On Demand. "The Exterminating Angel" opera can be accessed at https://bit.ly/2X6LUCm

The opera may be rented for $4.99 or watched by signing up for an on-demand subscription. The Met Opera On Demand Subscription is offered with a free seven-day free trial, after which the charge is $14.99/month.

Here's how this event will work:

1. Register your email address for the online video meeting by registering for free on the MAX SF website at https://bit.ly/2ynLOM2
The video meeting will be a Zoom meeting. Please be sure to provide an accurate email address so that you'll receive the invitation to the video meeting.

2. Sign-up for The Met Opera On Demand Subscription or rent "The Exterminating Angel" at https://bit.ly/2X6LUCm
Then watch the two-hour and twenty-two minute performance of "The Exterminating Angel" in your home sometime before 7pm April 21st.

3. Bruce will email a link for the Zoom meeting before April 21st.

4. On Tuesday April 21st, click on the link in the email from Bruce to join the 7pm Zoom meeting. Nothing else needs to be done.
If using a PC, you'll want a working microphone and speakers. If you have a webcam, then others will be able to see you. Zoom also works very well if you have an iPad or a smartphone - you just need to download the free app. You may also call-in with any phone and participate via voice only.

5. You'll be able to see and talk with others from MAX as you share your experiences watching "The Exterminating Angel" and share your thoughts on the performance.

You must register on the MAX SF website in order to receive the link to the Zoom meeting, participate in the Zoom meeting, and to receive any further details from the event champions.

Register on the MAX SF website to be invited to the Tuesday April 21st, 7pm Zoom meeting to discuss the recording of The Metropolitan Opera performance of "The Exterminating Angel".
REGISTER AT https://bit.ly/2ynLOM2

events.name: Navigating Turmoil: Insights to Maximize Emotional Health
events.description_html:
>>> THIS EVENT IS NOT FREE. PLEASE PURCHASE YOUR TICKET THROUGH MEETUP OR HERE THROUGH EVENTBRITE > https://outprofessionals.org/navigatingturmoil <<<

Isolation, job loss, economic fallout, and death are a few of the common and crushing stressors of the COVID-19 pandemic. In the midst of this chaos, we endure overt societal pressures urging us towards positivity and unrealistic productivity. As people we respond in unique ways and seldom take the time to slow down and explore them. During this overwelming time, we need to give ourselves permission to mourn, articulate grief, express disbelief, and broach sadness in order to achieve.

In this essential webinar, art therapist and psychotherapist Daniel Blausey will share insights from his 25-year career to fully engage all of your emotional responses during this time of crisis.

You will learn:

• How to “navigate turmoil” by exploring, not ignoring, our feelings of overwhelm.
• Why members of the LGBTQ communities may be especially vulnerable at this time.
• How to best address essential emotional health needs during the COVID-19 pandemic.
• Why creative practices are vital, and how to establish your own creative practices (regardless of talent level)
• The advantages adults experience when engaging in creative arts therapies.

Daniel Blausey, MA, ATR-BC, ATCS, LCAT is the founder of Studio Blue: Creative Arts Therapy, PLLC based in Manhattan. As an art therapist and psychotherapist for over 25 years, Daniel's areas of expertise include mental health care and family support for the LGBTQIA community, including sex positivity, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression and the coming out process. Before founding Studio Blue in 2011, he directed several New York City mental health programs including The Door (a youth agency) and GMHC/Gay Men’s Health Crisis (the oldest AIDS service organization). As a presenter, he has facilitated trainings, workshops, and paper presentations at the local, national, and international level.

This webinar is part of the 'Life Preserver' webinar series curated by Out Professionals to help LGBTQ professionals adapt and recover from the economic impacts of COVID-19. / Career. Culture. Community. We Connect You. Join us at outprofessionals.org

events.name: There There: listen together to the audio book: 4/8 (over Zoom)
events.description_html:
Join us to listen to this book on audio book! After saying "hi" we will turn off our videos and mute so we can listen while we cook, eat, clean, rest...whatever. The audio book is 8 hours long so we plan to meet 4 more times for an hour. We will plan next reading times together...with those that attend.

* Please try to be on time or a little early so we can listen for a full hour.

We'll discuss the book on May 13th. You don't need to listen with us. You can get the book and read it on your own. This is an option for those who might find it hard to get the book while the libraries are closed.

"This is the first novel by Cheyenne and Arapaho author Tommy Orange. Published in 2018, it opens with an essay by Orange as a prologue, and then proceeds to follow a large cast of Native Americans living in the area of Oakland, California, as they struggle with a wide array of challenges ranging from depression and alcoholism, to unemployment, fetal alcohol syndrome, and the challenges of living with an ethnic identity of being "ambiguously nonwhite." All coalesce at a community pow wow and its attempted robbery.

"The book explores the themes of Native peoples living in urban spaces (Urban Indians), and issues of ambivalence and complexity related to Natives' struggles with identity and authenticity. There There was favorably received, and was a finalist for the 2019 Pulitzer Prize. The book was also awarded a Gold Medal for First Fiction by the California Book Awards."
source for above: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/There_There_(novel)
(sorry, I couldn't find the author's website, my preference, Deb)

All are welcome.

ZOOM:
The meeting code will be posted in the comments on this page before the meeting. Only folks who RSVP will be let in from the "waiting room." Please join the call 5 minutes before the official meeting start time to make sure you can get on the call. We want to start listening to the book as soon as possible. Put a comment on this page if you are having problems getting in. (Please download Zoom in advance if you haven't used it before.)
