events.name: How the coronavirus is magnifying the racial and socio-economic disparities
events.description_html:
IMPORTANT: In order to participate create a profile on Zoom:

https://zoom.us/

If using Zoom for the first time, please download the app. It's free and only takes a few minutes to complete.

You'll receive a link to the Zoom videoconference one day before the Meetup.

*********************
We'll continue discussing the coronavirus pandemic. For the Ninth Session, we'll discuss how the coronavirus is exposing racial and socio-economic disparities in the U.S. In doing so, we'll evaluate the following:

• The purported truths and myths about the coronavirus being a “great equalizer" of our societal woes.

• How the African-American community is disproportionately devastated by the coronavirus. Are there deeper, fundamental reasons, other than the pandemic itself?

• How certain low-income groups are forced to go outside and work (by de facto means) notwithstanding "shelter-in-place" and lockdown measures.

• The direct correlation between low incomes vs. poor health and the severe underlying medical illnesses. Further, how the existing health disparities are resulting in more deaths for those with underlying illnesses.

• Finally, how the pandemic will worsen the livelihoods of the communities of color and the poor. What should be the appropriate direct government response, if any at all?

*********************
Upcoming sessions:

▨ Lessons from History -- the similarities and differences from the Spanish Influenza Pandemic of 1918.

▨ Is COVID-19 pandemic a preview of our climate change future?

▨ The politics of the pandemic response and how this will shape the 2020 elections.

▨ International cases and what COVID-19 means for foreign policy and relations.

▨ Where do we go from here?

*********************

Past sessions:

▨ Session One: Sharing our stories about coping, readiness and survival.
(https://www.meetup.com/NYC-Politics/events/269537632/)

▨ Session Two: COVID-19: From Wuhan to Washington to everywhere
(https://www.meetup.com/NYC-Politics/events/269537632/)

▨ Session Three: TED Talks: Did Bill Gates predict COVID-19 in 2015?
(https://www.meetup.com/NYC-Politics/events/269622313/)

▨ Session Four: The Economic Impacts of the Coronavirus
(https://www.meetup.com/NYC-Politics/events/269653040/)

▨ Session Five: The $2.2 TRILLION stimulus and mega-bailout
(https://www.meetup.com/NYC-Politics/events/269746655/)

▨ Session Six: COVID-19 Lockdowns vs. Our Individual Freedoms
(https://www.meetup.com/NYC-Politics/events/269792901/)

▨ Session Seven: The role of faith, spirituality and humanism during a pandemic. (https://www.meetup.com/NYC-Politics/events/269911744/)

▨ Session Eighth: Individualism vs. Utilitarianism vs. Collectivism during a pandemic (https://www.meetup.com/NYC-Politics/events/269972631/)

*********************

We'll limit the attendance to ten attendees for each session. Each event will be announced about two to three days beforehand.

events.name: Civic hacknight #238 VIRTUAL | Nomadic Labs, Luisa Ji + Sharon Kennedy
events.description_html:
+ Topic:

Luisa and Sharon (the two founders of Nomadic Labs) will be sharing their intentionally slow journey of building a digital studio and collaborating with social-good organizations to create design and technology. The talk will be in interview format - Luisa and Sharon will interview each other! The designer/developer duo plan to touch on the following topics:

- how diverse backgrounds and meandering career paths can bring human and social perspectives to their approaches to tech
- why we should all bring a bit of our personal lives into our work and vice versa
- insights on designing for the web while keeping our intentions in line with positive and sustained social impact

Luisa and Sharon would also like to chit chat away with everyone joining the virtual meetup on ways design and technology are empowering communities, initiatives, and organizations at various scales and enabling them to support each other’s work under the effects of the pandemic lockdown. How do we ensure that this work and all the good intentions going into it are not lost in the “new normal”?

Come help us chip away at civic problems by combining technology with the power of our community. We've got everything you need for a perfect Tuesday night: a presentation to learn from and some projects to work on.

+ Presenter Biography:

Luisa Ji is one of the two founders of Nomadic Labs, a digital studio working with social impact organizations, developing strategy and digital tools that enable people to manifest their purposes and build communities. Luisa has a background in architecture (M.ARCH) and a keen eye on identifying opportunities for bridging the digital with the physical spaces. Her work is entangled with organizations and entrepreneurs who imagine futures that are abundant, collaborative, and convivial, including the Design Futures Initiative (San Francisco) and UKAI Project

Sharon Kennedy is a multi-disciplinary software developer with experience in full-stack web development, web design, graphic design, online communications, and project management.

She is passionate about achieving meaningful impact with technology, which has taken her career on interesting turns from a UN agency in Dakar to a tech startup in Barcelona to a health tech company in Toronto. She's now happily a partner of Nomadic Labs, working with inspiring clients from around the world.

+ Social Media Cheat Codes:

@LuisalyJi
@Codeandcanoes
@Nomadic_Labs

@CivicTechTO #civictech
https://link.civictech.ca/tweet

+ Venue Sponsor:

Join us this week from the comfort of your own home, or wherever you are practicing social isolation, for a virtual civic tech hacknight!

+ Check-in details:

Join us via Zoom: https://us02web.zoom.us/j/85847811289?pwd=THhwOEQvTlh5R3QvbWxha25xTWdGUT09
Webcams and mics optional, but encouraged!

Check in with us on the Civic Tech Toronto Slack: https://link.civictech.ca/chat.

+ Accessibility:

We're exploring ways to make our online hacknights more accessible, but at the moment we only provide video of the presentation slides and audio.

+ About Us:

Our weekly civic tech hacknights bring together designers, coders, urban planners, government staff, mappers, policy-makers, students, communications strategists, and all other Torontonians who share an interest in making Toronto more responsive, prosperous, sustainable and equitable, through design, tech, and data. (Coders are welcome, but you don’t have to be a coder to contribute!) Come and be part of it!

+ Agenda:

6:45-7: Civic Tech 101
7-7:10: Welcome and Introductions
7:10-7:40: Presentation and Q&A/discussion
7:40-9: Breakout groups (go make something!)

For more info, visit http://civictech.ca
Here's our Code of Conduct: http://civictech.ca/about-us

Hope to see you Tuesday!

events.description_html:

This global pandemic also underscores the extreme importance of our being able to Vote By Mail in the upcoming elections. For years, Vote By Mail has been the most convenient method of voting; now it is also the lowest risk to health. Click Here to request Vote By Mail online or to check your Vote By Mail status (your Vote By Mail request needs to be renewed periodically). https://www.precinctfind.com/ab_status/ab_status_sar.php?op=lookup

The Democratic Party is very concerned about the impact of this health crisis on our upcoming August and November elections. The virus may be beyond our control, but defeating Donald Trump on November 3rd is within our control if every single Democrat votes. And that can be assured if every Democrat registers to Vote by Mail.

Several of our local Democratic Candidates need your help. To qualify for the upcoming ballots, each candidate needs to submit a large number of signed petitions (or face paying a large filing fee) over the next few weeks. Please Click Here to download their petitions, then print, sign, and mail (or scan and email) your completed petitions to them as soon as you can. https://www.sarasotadems.org/2020/01/01/2020-candidate-petitions/

Our voter outreach operations have shifted from in-person to online, digital, and telephone – so now is not the time to sit back and rest. Use this time to connect with neighbors, to help meet needs, to serve our community, to speak up, to be engaged citizens with a clear understanding of the way things SHOULD work. In these times, we can't help but be reminded that elections have serious consequences. Please Click Here to be a part of the change and get involved. https://www.sarasotadems.org/volunteer/

These are also days in which we must be humans first: caring, compassionate, and responsive to our friends, family and neighbors in need. And for those of us who are in need – of anything – please reach out and let us know. We can work together to get through this.

Be safe,

JoAnne DeVries, Chair

events.name: Pandemic Religion: COVID-19's Impact on Our Beliefs and Spiritual Values
events.description_html:
Encounter CO is hosting conversation in contentious times - as well as the chaotic. This session's topic is on religion during this time of global plight: the COVID-19 pandemic. The session will be hosted online via Zoom (see link below).

The pandemic has a wide range of impacts on the human experience. While we hear reports of death tolls, economic impacts, and efforts to flatten the curve, how has this virus affected our inner worlds? Our communities? Our spiritual practices? What impact does a life of predominantly virtual relationships have on us and our sense of connection? How has limited movement changed our well-being?

In times of crisis, belief, connection (with others or to something more spiritual), and well-being can serve as ways for coping with rising uncertainty of what the future holds. What does that look like in a time of social distancing? Can religious traditions and communities moved online have the same impact? What are some alternative ways to engage spirituality in the "new normal"?

While we cannot come together physically, Encounter CO is committed to fostering dialogue virtually. Please join us for a Zoom call April 21st, 7:00-8:30pm.

Follow this link for the PDF handout of our questions of the event! https://drive.google.com/open?id=1KfBng8ulDMH6sR-1NB2pVdyLee6A7KK_

INSTRUCTIONS FOR HOW TO ATTEND

We will be requiring a password to enter the event in order to maintain a secure environment for all participants. Please read the instructions below on how to RSVP and get the password prior to the event:

Please RSVP "going" on the event page and we will send you the password in a direct message.

To join on the day of the event, click the link below. It will direct you to the Zoom site where if you do not have an account, it will ask you to sign up or continue without an account.

If you choose to not use a Zoom account, it will ask you to enter your name before joining the meeting. (Your name will not be kept in the Zoom system, it will just appear at the bottom of your screen for us to see. First name is enough!)

If you would like to make an account before the meeting, go to https://zoom.us/ and follow the sign up process. Basic accounts are free and all that is necessary to participate!

You are also able to download an app for your phone and/or computer, but it is not necessary. It will prompt you to do so after entering the meeting ID/clicking the link below.

It will also ask if you want to join with video, and we would recommend yes (we love to see your faces!) but we will not require it.

We will close the event at 7:20PM as managing late comers through Zoom's platform is more complicated and disruptive than in person late-arrivals. Please be sure to arrive before then!

events.name: The Dublin Book Club Meetup Group Monthly Meetup
events.organiser: The Dublin Book Club Meetup Group
events.description_html:
here are the books for the April 21st meetup. And remember, you don't have to read both books! Enjoy, and see you on the 21st April!

PLEASE NOTE: This is a rescheduling of the March meetup, which was cancelled, plus an additional book for April: the Dublin One City One Book choice Tatty.

Note: If these books are difficult to find in bookshops, try online (e.g.: Amazon.co.uk, kennys.ie, easons.com, bookdepository.com to name a few).

AS THIS GROUP DOES NOT TAKE ONLINE PAYMENTS, EVERYONE WILL SHOW AS 'UNPAID'. PLEASE IGNORE.

1. English Passengers – Matthew Kneale

A historical novel written by Matthew Kneale, which won the Whitbread Book Award and was shortlisted for the Booker Prize and the Miles Franklin Award. It is narrated by 20 different characters and tells the story of a voyage to look for the Garden of Eden in Tasmania and the rapid decline of that island’s indigenous population of Tasmanian Aborigines. In 1857 when Captain Illiam Quillian Kewley and his band of rum smugglers from the Isle of Man have most of their contraband confiscated by British Customs, they are forced to put their ship up for charter. The only takers are two eccentric Englishmen who want to embark for the other side of the globe. The Reverend Geoffrey Wilson believes the Garden of Eden was on the island of Tasmania. His travelling partner, Dr. Thomas Potter, unbeknownst to Wilson, is developing a sinister thesis about the races of men. Meanwhile, an aboriginal in Tasmania named Peevay recounts his people’s struggles against the invading British, a story that begins in 1824, moves into the present with approach of the English passengers in 1857, and extends into the future in 1870. These characters and many others come together in a storm of voices that vividly bring a past age to life.

2. Blood Meridian - Cormac McCarthy

Blood Meridian by Cormac McCarthy is an epic novel of the violence and depravity that attended America's westward expansion, brilliantly subverting the conventions of the Western novel and the mythology of the Wild West. Based on historical events that took place on the Texas-Mexico border in the 1850s, it traces the fortunes of the Kid, a fourteen-year-old Tennessean who stumbles into a nightmarish world where Indians are being murdered and the market for their scalps is thriving.

3. Tatty - Christine Dwyer Hickey

Hailed by the critics as a masterpiece, Tatty is a devastating yet hilarious depiction of a troubled Dublin family, told through the lively, charismatic voice of a little girl over a 10-year period.

During this time we see the destruction brought about by alcoholism as one little girl tries to come to terms with her parents' drinking. This is the story of a disturbed childhood, yet it is also filled with humour and love. Chapter by chapter, the child's voice matures and her perception becomes more honed; we are left with a stunning portrait of a disintegrating family and the child lost within it.

Séamus

events.name: Daily Morning Meditation (Zazen) at Two Arrows Zen, Monday - Friday
events.organiser: Two Arrows Zen - Artspace Zendo, Salt Lake City
events.description_html:
You are warmly welcome to join Michael Mugaku Zimmerman Roshi and the Two Arrows Zen sangha for morning meditation, Monday through Friday.

There are two sitting periods: 7:00 - 7:35 am, and 7:45 - 8:15 am. Meditation cushions and chairs are provided. No prior experience with meditation is required. You may join for one period, or for both. If it is your first time, please come a few minutes before the first sit so we can provide a little orientation.

On Tuesday mornings, the second sitting period is the Morning Service, when we chant the core texts of our practice: The Heart Sutra, the Identity of Relative and Absolute, and the Enmei Jukku Kannon Gyo in celebration of Kanzeon, the Bodhisattva of Compassion. There's incense and bells, full bows, and you'll probably see a few folks in robes.

Arrive a little early for coffee or tea if you need a wake-up. After sitting, we offer a friendly bowl of oatmeal and conversation every morning before you go on to the rest of your day.

Membership is required after your first month; donations are always welcome. (Donation is $5 per day or Two Arrows Meditator Membership ($30/month.)

Street clothing is fine; we take off shoes in the zendo. No shorts or tank tops, please. Please arrive on time to be settled in the zendo 5 minutes before the sit begins.

Two Arrows Zen is closed for major holidays and for our Winter and Spring Sesshins. Please check the Calendar for the program on specific dates. https://www.twoarrowszen.org/calendar/

We're looking forward to seeing you in the zendo!

p.s. for more formal meditation instruction, consider coming to A Day of Zen for meditation and teaching. You'll find more information at https://www.twoarrowszen.org/programs-retreats/

We’re a group of tech types who realize that adding soft skills to our technical talents makes us more effective in our careers, businesses and the rest of our lives. · Developer

…or if you just have a passion for technology, communication and leadership you owe it to yourself to check out TechMasters. We meet every Tuesday from 7:45 am to 9:00 am at Improving Enterprises (https://www.google.com/maps/place/3600+American+Blvd+W+%23115,+Bloomington,+MN+55431/@44.8571422,-93.3280922,17z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m5!3m4!1s0x87f6246ce7100723:0xd8b8e41dbd7ac763!8m2!3d44.8571384!4d-93.3259035) in Bloomington BUT ARE TEMPORARILY MEETING ONLINE AT http://bit.ly/TMVirtual ). Stop by any Tuesday morning and see what we're all about and if we'd be a good fit for you.

Note: not everyone attending will RSVP on Meet-up. Far more members and guests show up than RSVP

The club website is: www.techmasters-tc.com (http://www.techmasters-tc.com/)

You can learn more about Toastmasters at toastmasters.org (http://www.toastmasters.org)

events.description_html:
Our Qigong classes are online due to the Coronavirus!

This is a 30-minute live class at 8:15am daily. On saturdays we will extend the class to about 9:15am to teach new exercises. A $5 donation per class or $20 for the week is suggested but not required. Please Venmo to @evosia We want everyone to be able to take the class without concerns for their tight budgets at this time. Stay healthy, improve your immune system, and learn powerful tools for your mind, body and spirit.

All of our past classes are available on our YouTube channel Evosia Wellness. Please like and subscribe! Link: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC301jxbuA0f2weTwspoYadg

It's a scary and uncertain time for all of us. But it doesn't have to be all there is right now. You've got us and we've got you! Look at this stay at home time as an opportunity to reset, grow, learn and plan for the next chapter in your life. Take charge! Qigong can be an incredible tool to help you in your journey.

Mary Frances will be leading most of these live classes. Thank you and we hope to see you in class!

events.description_html: Tai Chi and Qigong improve the various bodily functions by improving the body's natural energy flow and capacity with simple standing or seating postures, body movement and harmonized breath. events.name: Visionsarbeit und Collaboration mit Lego® Serious Play®
events.description_html:
Erfahrungsgemäß fällt es vielen Menschen schwer, sich mit der eigenen Person, der eigenen beruflichen und persönlichen Perspektive und Zukunftsvorstellung auseinanderzusetzen.

Und doch setzen sich gerade JETZT- in dieser Krisenzeit – viele Menschen mit Ihrer persönlichen und beruflichen Zukunft auseinander. Die Einen, weil sie es vielleicht MÜSSEN und die Anderen, weil sie es vielleicht WOLLEN und jetzt auch die Zeit dafür haben.

Nehmt das Thema AKTIV in die Hand und geht mit uns die ersten Schritte – gemeinsam, statt einsam! 😊

Ganz KREATIV gehen wir mit LEGO und der Lego Serious® Play® Methode in die Gestaltung des Themas.

Das nimmst Du mit in Deine erfolgreiche Zukunft:
Du wirst erkennen, warum mit Lego arbeiten Deine Kreativität weckt und fördert. Du wirst unterstützt Deine Vision zu gestalten, die im Kopf bleibt. Du wirst erleben, was Lego-Profis mit „Thinging“ meinen, Du wirst Deine Story bauen und Dich mit anderen austauschen. Ganz AKTIV erarbeitest Du Deine persönliche VISION und lernst nebenbei noch den Umgang mit digitaler Technik und das Arbeiten im virtuellen Raum.

Das Teilnehmerlimit beträgt 8 Personen.
Wir arbeiten nach first come - first serve ...
Bei erhöhter Nachfrage planen wir gern ein weiteres Event.

Du meldest dich mit einer Mail an [masked] an. Gebe bitte folgende Daten mit:

- deinen Vor- und Nachnamen - für die Rechnung
- deine Postadresse … damit Du das Material zugeschickt bekommst (inkl. frankierten Rückumschlag für eine einfache Rücksendung des Materials).

Technische Voraussetzungen:
- Einen Laptop / Tablett oder Smartphone mit (integrierter) Webcam und Headset oder (integriertem Mikro).
- Hinweis: Ein fester Bildschirm kann als Primärgerat genutzt werden, sollte jedoch mit einem mobilen Endgerät für die „aktiven Phasen“ ergänzt werden. Gern stehen wir Euch für weitere technische Empfehlungen/Instruktionen zur Verfügung!

Agenda:

- 15:00 Uhr: Begrüßung
- Einführung in die Zusammenarbeit im virtuellen Raum
- Warm Up mit Lego
- Impuls durch Anke und Frank
- Visionsarbeit „Dein individuelles Modell mit Lego“
- Reflektion & Austausch
- Gegen 17:30 Uhr: Feedback

Wir freuen uns auf euch!

events.name: Art Journaling - Zoom meeting
events.description_html:
We'll meet on Zoom this month. We'll just have an open journaling session and share what we have been journaling since we've been staying home.
Mostly this will give us an opportunity create together and chat.

The zoom link will be added before the meeting but can only be seen by those signing up ahead.

Don't miss it!!!

Your art journal is a small personal space for you to experiment with creating images, playing with color, write your thoughts or build upon an idea that speaks to you. No special skills required, you don’t have to know how to draw or paint or anything. You can be a beginner, a seasoned artist or anything in between. There are no rules to follow, no set way of creating a journal.

Art journaling is open to all dues paying members. There is no set fee, though donations can be made to the teacher of the session to cover materials and say thanks.

If you are brand new to our meetup and want to check us out, we encourage you to attend our monthly 1st Saturday meetup, but you may attend art journaling if it works better for you or if art journaling is your main interest.

Bring a book to use as a journal - a sketchbook or mixed media or watercolor book will work well. Some artists use altered books or just sheets of paper they plan to bind at some point. Markers, paints, stencils, stamps, watercolors, acrylic paints and items to add for collages are all great for an art journal. Mostly bring a willingness to explore your creativity in an open, non-judgemental setting, where mistakes can lead to an insight or an opportunity to paint over that stray mark and take on a different vision for your page.

IF YOU ARE HAVING DIFFICULTY REGISTERING PLEASE CONTACT LINDA BATWAY AT [masked].

This is a *FREE* online meetup that you can easily participate if you have a smartphone or a PC in a safe environment such as at home to prevent COVID-19.

We do video chatting by using the "ZOOM" app. "ZOOM Cloud Meetings" app (for Smartphone and Tablet PC) or "Zoom Client for Meetings" app (for PC) which you can get from the link below, App Store, or Google Play.
*You have to install the app, but you don't have to create an account.
*Please check the link below for how to use the "Zoom" app.

💻 Download
https://zoom.us/download/
💻 How to use
https://support.zoom.us/hc/

📱💻 Flow

📱 Before this meetup

Apply on this page.
↓
Install the "Zoom" app.
↓
Check the following rules before the meetup.
- This meetup is held 40 minutes and stops automatically.
- Click "Zoom Link for Meetup" after the scheduled time.
- Each group is from 2 to 8 people.
- "Organizer" organizes only, don't talk in this meetup.
- Be sure to have a camera and a microphone.
- Video chat participation is required.
- We do not lecture on how to use smartphones, PCs or apps.
- Keep one person talking within 20 seconds.
- Cooperate so that all participants have the same chance to speak.
- Talk to people with a "Nickname".
- Help and respect each other for good communication.
- Prepare a short self-introduction (Nickname, Country of origin, City where you live) in advance.
- Think about the topic in advance and decide together what topic we will talk about.

📱 At the time of meetup participation

Click the "Zoom links for meetups" at the top to join.
*Use your name as you registered in "Meetup".
↓
Push the "Join Breakout Room" button.
*We invited you to join the breakout room
*Smartphone: Touch the screen of the Zoom app and a button will appear at the top left of the screen.
*PC: Button is at the bottom right of the Zoom app
↓
Start within 2-5 minutes.
Short self-introduction each other.
Decide together what topic we will talk about.
Start a conversation.
↓
Automatically ends after around 40 minutes.

📱 Feedback
Please give us feedback on getting better from the following link.
https://bit.ly/3boZAwf

＝＝＝＝＝＝＝＝＝＝

新型コロナウイルス感染症対策のため、ご自宅等の安心な環境で、スマホやPCがあればどなたでも気軽に参加できる無料のオンライン交流会です。

交流会では『ZOOM』というアプリを使用しビデオ通話で行います。『ZOOM Cloud Meetings』アプリ (スマートフォンやタブレット端末用)『ミーティング用Zoomクライアント』アプリ（PC用）アプリは下記リンクや App Store、Google Play で入手できます。
※参加はアプリのインストールが必要ですがアカウントの作成は不要です
※"Zoom"アプリの使い方は下記リンクより確認ください

💻 Download
https://zoom.us/download/
💻 How to use
https://support.zoom.us/hc/

📱💻 流れ

📱 交流会参加前

こちらのページの参加ボタンを押してください。
↓
『Zoom』アプリをインストール。
↓
交流会前に以下のルールを確認ください。
- 交流会は開始から約40分で自動的に終了します。
- 『Zoom Link for Meetup』はイベント開始時間後に押してください。
- 交流会は2名から6名のグループで行います。
- オーガナイザーは交流会の管理のみで参加しません。
- カメラとマイクを必ず用意すること。
- ビデオチャットでの参加が必須です。
- スマホ、パソコン、アプリの使い方の案内はしません。
- 一人が話す時間は20秒以内に留めること。
- すべての参加者が平等に話せるよう協力ください。
- 相手を「ニックネーム」で呼び会話することを心掛けましょう。
- 良いコミュニケーションをするためにお互い尊重し、助け合いましょう。
- 事前に自己紹介（ニックネーム、出身国、住んでいる街）を準備ください。
- 事前に話す話題を考え、何を話すか一緒に決めましょう。

📱 交流会開始時

一番上の『Zoom links for meetups』を押す。

↓

*スマホ: Zoomアプリの画面をタッチすると画面左上にボタンが現れます

約3-5分後に開始します。
それぞれ短時間の自己紹介をしましょう。
それぞれ用意した話題を披露し、皆で話し合う話題を決めましょう。

events.name: VIRTUAL Intermediate French Conversation (teleconference)
events.organiser: Calendar of French Events in Fort Collins
events.description_html:
For the meantime, instead of meeting at the Bean Cycle for Tuesday morning Intermediate French Conversation, we will be doing so virtually!

During the meeting time, just click on this link on either your computer or smartphone:
https://zoom.us/j/2273665065

and follow the simple instructions (which will have you download either the Zoom app or browser extension).

You are free to join or leave the teleconference any time you wish during the meeting. I hope you join!

Note: to ensure a safe requirement, we request that no one privately records these meetings. I have turned the ability to do so on Zoom off.

À bientôt!

events.name: Conversación con café
events.organiser: Olé Café Spanish Language Meetup Group
events.description_html: *AHORA EN LINEA* (En Zoom, Meeting ID:[masked]) Conversen con nativos y estudiantes/aficionados del español. Conéctate sin miedo, este es un grupo para conocer a otros y aprender. Para hablantes de todos los niveles. (todos niveles) Los eventos tendrán un precio de $5 para pagar a las facilitadoras. SI NO HAY 3 PARTICIPANTES EL DIA ANTERIOR, CANCELAREMOS EL EVENTO Y TU PAGO SERÁ DEVUELTO :) ¡Gracias por tu colaboración!

events.name: Online Friendly French Conversation Class
events.description_html:
Update:
Starting March 19th, all classes have been happening on Zoom. Please make sure you download it prior to the class. The link to join will be sent to participants upon attendance confirmation/payment. No registration needed on your part.

A friendly and non judgmental class for people who are determined to speak French and not just be able to read and write it. We read or listen to a dialogue or an article and we dissect it to make sure it is fully understood. All mistakes are corrected. New vocabulary is regularly introduced. Classes are $20 per person and are conducted by an established French tutor who speaks the language as a mother tongue.

Do reach out if you have any questions.

events.name: [ONLINE] Intermediate French Conversation (B1-2 level)
events.description_html:
Je serai présent aujourd’hui

This is an online class.

Je vais utiliser la série FLE de SAISON B1-2 de Didier. C'est disponible gratuitement (aussi longtemps que dure cette pandémie).

Vous pouvez créer un compte et avoir accès aux livres ici:
https://didier.landing-hachette.fr/vosmanuelsfle/

In the past I have covered intro to French, politics, articles from Le Monde or Nouvel Obs, culture, or just general conversation.

Try to be on time. If members are late, I’ll wait online for about 15 minutes. Please email me if you have questions or plan on being a little late

So I know how many are attending, please RSVP at https://www.meetup.com/frenchlessons/

IMPORTANT - the link and password for the session will be visible only to people who rsvp on meetup - this is a security issue. You can always contact me if you're having trouble joining us

events.name: Afternoon Conversation and Grammar
events.description_html:
THE CLASS IS MOVING TO THE ZOOM PLATFORM FOR THE DURATION OF THE CORONAVIRUS EPIDEMIC. THERE IS MORE INFORMATION IN THE ABOUT US BOX ON THE GROUP HOME PAGE.
The class combines some grammar review work with conversation. The goal is to help English Second Language learners express themselves better in as short a time as possible. As always, the class is biased toward business people and Business English, but I adapt the class to the attendees.

events.name: Virtual Meetup: Conversation Circle
events.description_html:
Hi all,

Here is the link. Click and enter the meeting: https://zoom.us/j/466038552

In this difficult time it is important to remain safe and healthy in the warmth of our home. But just as important is to maintain connections with others and to continue to learn and grow as human beings.

Our meetup has always been about providing a space for making friends and having fun and we will continue to be that even with all of the craziness. I will message a link to the Zoom room to all the people that RSVP to this event.

Let's have fun and Connect:)

events.name: Free: Estate Planning 101 during the Corona Virus
events.description_html:
AN EXTREMELY NECESSARY FREE EVENT TO GAIN A VERY NEEDED PIECE OF MIND!

Whether you are 21 or 81, it is never too look to plan or evaluate your estate planning – especially during unpredictable times.
– Is it time to prepare a will?
– Are your assets protected?
– Is your family protected (children, parents, etc.)
– Are you concerned about estate planning for any relatives who may be unable to make proper decisions for themselves? Make sure your affairs are in order!

Kerri M. Castellini, chair of the Price Benowitz LLP Trust and Estate Practice Group will speak on the basics of estate planning to help you ensure that your family and loved ones are provided for after a catastrophic event. Don’t rely on an amateur YouTube video for this. One of the leading experts in the area will unseal the basics of Wills, Trusts, and planning for all necessary unexpected scenarios.

About the Speaker: Kerri serves as Board Member for the Women’s Bar Association Foundation, and is a recent past President of the Women’s Bar Association of the District of Columbia. She is a member of the Washington D.C. Estate Planning Counsel. She was named a Fellow for the American Bar Foundation in 2012, and a Rising Star by Super Lawyers since 2017. Kerri is admitted to practice law in the State of Maryland, the District of Columbia, and the Commonwealth of Virginia and before the Supreme Court of the United States. (Click HERE for More Details)

All chatroom links and invitations will be sent out a few minutes before the event (to ensure only registrants attend). They will be sent to the email address you use to register for the event.

Any unauthorized person, or any person acting inappropriately during the chat room, or anyone using this as a forum to sell their own services or products will be immediately removed and blocked.

events.name: French Conversation
events.organiser: Francophones et Francophiles de Mississauga et Oakville
events.description_html:
Bonjour!

J'espère que tout va bien pour tous!
Je vais faire quelques changements. Le nom du groupe sur Facebook va changer,  parce que je me suis rendue compte qu'il y à un autre groupe avec le même nom. Je vais appeler le groupe "J'adore le Français", comme le groupe sur messenger.
Je ne vais pas aller sur Zoom, comme quelqu'un m'a dit qu'il y a des problèmes au niveau des informations et que celles-ci ne  sont plus confidentielles. 
Demain après-midi, (jeudi) j'aimerai faire un essai sur messenger, mais voix seulement, pas vidéo. La semaine prochaine, je pourrais le faire en vidéo. Faites moi savoir si ça vous intéresse.  On peut faire individuellement où en groupe.
Je serai disponible tous les jours, de 13 à 15h et serai sur messenger, pour vous répondre!
Joingnez-moi sur le groupe sur messenger et parlons cette langue si belle!!

events.name: Online Fingerspelling
events.description_html:
Gregg Bellman is inviting you to a scheduled Zoom meeting.

Lets practice our fingerspelling and receptive skills. We are still working out the bugs so the first part of the event will be setup to make sure everyone has a understanding of how everything works.

Topic: Sign Language Practice

Every week on Tue

Please download and import the following iCalendar (.ics) files to your calendar system.
Weekly: https://us04web.zoom.us/meeting/v5crcOCgrj8tAbO1Vl4mG7URZ0f-78r6Bw/ics?icsToken=98tyKuurqDwjEtSRt1-CUbQqOa_qbPG5llBMhfJrkEvoJHdmUDmmMK8VaqApMs-B

Join Zoom Meeting
https://us04web.zoom.us/j/236798047

Meeting ID:[masked]

events.name: LET'S READ TOGETHER: Italian bookclub by video conference on SKYPE
events.organiser: LA Italian Language & Culture Friend: all classes on SKYPE
events.description_html:
Buongiorno e Benvenuti

During this class we read together an Italian novel - fiction book and we translate it back to English, it is an excellent reading comprehension and we also have interesting conversation.

I PROVIDE THE PDF OF THE BOOK TO ALL MEMBER THAT JOIN THE CLASS
It is not meant for absolute beginners, but everyone is welcome to join us and learn from other students.

IN ORDER TO JOIN THIS CLASS, YOU MUST SEND ME YOUR SKYPE NAME THROUGH A PRIVATE MESSAGE, AND I WILL ADD YOU TO THE GROUP.
I will keep your account name private.

events.name: Paul Celan 100: Todesfuge and Todtnauberg
events.organiser: Modernist Fiction, Its Origins and Beyond... and other stuff
events.description_html:
To commemorate the 100th Anniversary of Paul Celan’s birth this year on November 23, 2020 we will read two of his poems Todesfuge and Todtnauberg.

"Todesfuge" (translated into English as Death Fugue and Fugue of Death) is a German language poem written by the Romanian-born poet Paul Celan probably around 1945 and first published in 1948. It is "among [Celan's] most well-known and often-anthologized poems". Despite critics claiming that the lyrical finesse and aesthetic of the poem did not do justice to the cruelty of the Holocaust, others regard the poem as one that "combines mysteriously compelling imagery with rhythmic variations and structural patterns that are both elusive and pronounced". At the same time it has been regarded as a "masterful description of horror and death in a concentration camp". Celan was born to a Jewish family in Cernauti, Romania (now Chernivtsy, Ukraine); his parents died in a camp during the Second World War, and Celan himself was a prisoner for a time in a work camp. The poem has reached international relevance by being considered to be one of the most important poems of the post-war period and the most relevant example of Trümmerliteratur.

In 1967, Martín Heidegger met with the poet Paul Celan, a Jew who had survived concentration camps operated by the Nazis' Romanian allies. On July 24 Celan gave a reading at the University of Freiburg, attended by Heidegger. Heidegger there presented Celan with a copy of What is Called Thinking?, and invited him to visit him at his hut at Todtnauberg, an invitation which Celan accepted. On July 25 Celan visited Heidegger at his retreat, signing the guestbook and spending some time walking and talking with Heidegger. The details of their conversation are not known, but the meeting was the subject of a subsequent poem by Celan, entitled "Todtnauberg" (dated August 1, 1967). The enigmatic poem and the encounter have been discussed by numerous writers on Heidegger and Celan, notably Philippe Lacoue-Labarthe. A common interpretation of the poem is that it concerns, in part, Celan's wish for Heidegger to apologize for his behavior during the Nazi era.

Todesfuge online text:
http://poemsintranslation.blogspot.com/2010/01/paul-celan-death-fugue-from-german.html?m=1

Todtnauberg online text:
https://www.poetryfoundation.org/poems/58209/todtnauberg

events.name: Talking to Strangers by Malcom Gladwell
events.description_html:
From Amazon:
Malcolm Gladwell, host of the podcast Revisionist History and author of the number-one New York Times best seller Outliers, reinvents the audiobook in this immersive production of Talking to Strangers, a powerful examination of our interactions with people we don’t know.

How did Fidel Castro fool the CIA for a generation? Why did Neville Chamberlain think he could trust Adolf Hitler? Why are campus sexual assaults on the rise? Do television sitcoms teach us something about the way we relate to each other that isn't true?

While tackling these questions, Malcolm Gladwell was not solely writing a book for the page. He was also producing for the ear. In the audiobook version of Talking to Strangers, you’ll hear the voices of people he interviewed - scientists, criminologists, military psychologists. Court transcripts are brought to life with re-enactments. You actually hear the contentious arrest of Sandra Bland by the side of the road in Texas. As Gladwell revisits the deceptions of Bernie Madoff, the trial of Amanda Knox, and the suicide of Sylvia Plath, you hear directly from many of the players in these real-life tragedies. There’s even a theme song - Janelle Monae’s “Hell You Talmbout”.

Something is very wrong, Gladwell argues, with the tools and strategies we use to make sense of people we don't know. And because we don't know how to talk to strangers, we are inviting conflict and misunderstanding in ways that have a profound effect on our lives and our world.

We will start promptly at 6 with our ice-breaker question: How has sheltering in place changed your reading habits? What have you enjoyed lately?

Want to take part? Just email the bookstore at [masked] to rsvp and they will send you the log in information before the meeting. Speaking of E. Shavers, you can still purchase books for upcoming discussions from them at a discount and receive them safely. Just let Jessica and Melissa know when you email and they can arrange it for you.

It won't be the same as meeting in person, but we do really look forward to gathering with y'all to talk about this book.

Frank and Victoria Logue

events.name: Social Justice Book Club - Rising: Dispatches from the New American Shore
events.description_html:
April's read is Elizabeth Rush's Rising: Dispatches from the New American Shore.

This will be a virtual meeting and we will send the link out closer to the meeting date. Do note, that all plans are tentative during these times.

We have a few FREE copies available thanks to the UCSB Library as part of their UCSB Reads programming. If you would like a copy, please email [masked] to work out the details. The title is also available instantly as an E-Book on hoopla >> https://www.hoopladigital.com/title/12160247.

"Hailed as “deeply felt” (New York Times), “a revelation” (Pacific Standard), and “the book on climate change and sea levels that was missing” (Chicago Tribune), Rising is both a highly original work of lyric reportage and a haunting meditation on how to let go of the places we love.

With every passing day, and every record-breaking hurricane, it grows clearer that climate change is neither imagined nor distant—and that rising seas are transforming the coastline of the United States in irrevocable ways. In Rising, Elizabeth Rush guides readers through some of the places where this change has been most dramatic, from the Gulf Coast to Miami, and from New York City to the Bay Area. For many of the plants, animals, and humans in these places, the options are stark: retreat or perish in place.

Weaving firsthand testimonials from those facing this choice—a Staten Islander who lost her father during Sandy, the remaining holdouts of a Native American community on a drowning Isle de Jean Charles, a neighborhood in Pensacola settled by escaped slaves hundreds of years ago—with profiles of wildlife biologists, activists, and other members of these vulnerable communities, Rising privileges the voices of those too often kept at the margins."
- https://www.pulitzer.org/finalists/elizabeth-rush

____________________
Each month we will read a different book that will have us examine different social injustices, stereotypes, and prejudices that exist in our current world. Whether it be an inspiring coming-of-age novel in the civil rights south, a true story of adversity challenging unjust laws, a beautiful picture book embracing all families, or a book of essays and prose from civil rights activists, this book club will explore all the facets of our shared humanity.

In partnership with Just Communities, Pacific Pride Foundation, Santa Barbara Transgender Advocacy Network, and Showing Up for Racial Justice.

To be added to the email list for the Social Justice Book Club please send your name and email address to [masked].

events.name: Apr - Ninth House by Leigh Bardugo
events.description_html:
Come discuss 2019's Best Fantasy Book

Meeting ID[masked]
Meeting Password[masked]

Ninth House
(Alex Stern #1)
by Leigh Bardugo (Goodreads Author)
4.17 · Rating details · 23,246 ratings · 5,313 reviews
Galaxy “Alex” Stern is the most unlikely member of Yale’s freshman class. Raised in the Los Angeles hinterlands by a hippie mom, Alex dropped out of school early and into a world of shady drug dealer boyfriends, dead-end jobs, and much, much worse. By age twenty, in fact, she is the sole survivor of a horrific, unsolved multiple homicide. Some might say she’s thrown her life away. But at her hospital bed, Alex is offered a second chance: to attend one of the world’s most elite universities on a full ride. What’s the catch, and why her?

Still searching for answers to this herself, Alex arrives in New Haven tasked by her mysterious benefactors with monitoring the activities of Yale’s secret societies. These eight windowless “tombs” are well-known to be haunts of the future rich and powerful, from high-ranking politicos to Wall Street and Hollywood’s biggest players. But their occult activities are revealed to be more sinister and more extraordinary than any paranoid imagination might conceive.

events.name: ONLINE EVENT: A Spool of Blue Thread by Anne Tyler
events.description_html:
Sandi is hosting this month. Since we have to stay home due to the pandemic, this meeting will be online. Just click the online event link and it will take you to the meeting.

“It was a beautiful, breezy, yellow-and-green afternoon. . . . ” This is how Abby Whitshank always describes the day she fell in love with Red in July 1959. The Whitshanks are one of those families that radiate an indefinable kind of specialness, but like all families, their stories reveal only part of the picture: Abby and Red and their four grown children have accumulated not only tender moments, laughter, and celebrations, but also jealousies, disappointments, and carefully guarded secrets. From Red’s parents, newly arrived in Baltimore in the 1920s, to the grandchildren carrying the Whitshank legacy boisterously into the twenty-first century, here are four generations of lives unfolding in and around the sprawling, lovingly worn house that has always been their anchor.

events.name: REVOLUTION by K.T. McFarland-Virtual Book Club
events.description_html:
When Trump’s first Deputy National Security Advisor left Washington, she disappeared from sight. Now former government official and political commentator KT McFarland returns with tenacity, resolve, and the truth about the Trump Administration and those seeking to destroy it.

For decades, KT McFarland has been one of the country’s most prominent conservative foreign policy experts. She was part of the Trump Revolution from the beginning. As Trump’s first Deputy National Security Advisor, she had a seat at the table for everything: Trump’s unconventional campaign and upset victory; his throw-out-the-rule-book Trump Tower Transition; the chaotic first months in the West Wing; the unusual events surrounding General Flynn’s firing; and the sprawling Mueller investigation.

In Revolution, she walks the reader through the Washington Establishment’s relentless efforts to destroy Trump, populism, and nationalism in order to keep their own hands on the levers of power. The Trump Revolution, like the Reagan Revolution and all the anti-Establishment political revolutions before it, will ultimately prevail. It is this ability to reinvent ourselves, not just as individuals but as a society, that lies at the heart of American Exceptionalism.

When McFarland left the Trump Administration and Washington, she disappeared from public view and refused to discuss her experiences. Now, for the first time, McFarland tells a story that reads more like a political thriller than a tour through this unique moment in history. Written with unusual candor, with insights into Trump and his inner circle, Putin, Xi Jinping, and Kim Jong-un, McFarland’s book is destined to become a classic.

If you only read one book about the Age of Trump, make it Revolution: Trump, Washington and “ We the People.”

Premium Pass Hat (value $25) & Airshow Souvenir Program (value $10) Note: Grandstands are not wheelchair accessible Photographer's Pit Pass inclusions: - Free priority parking - 2-Day admission to Warbirds Downunder 2020 Airshow & Temora Aviation Museum - Amazing location to view aircraft taxiing, taking off & landing - Exclusive area for photographers only - Grandstand with (unallocated) bench type seats - Toilets - Marquee with tables, chairs & charging points Note: this area is away from the GA area and Food areas Run Times: Gates: 8:30am Saturday: 11:00am to 4:30pm Sunday: 10:30am to 3:00pm All times approximate and subject to change

events.name: Warbirds Downunder Airshow 2020

events.summary: Running Times - Doors 8:00pm Start 8:30pm Finish 11:00pm *Please note all times are approximate & subject to change.

events.name: Paul Kelly and Paul Grabowsky: Please Leave Your Light On
events.summary: Running Times: Doors - 6:30pm, Jess Hitchcock - 8:00pm, Finish - 10:30pm, *Please note all times are approximate and subject to change. Other than sharing the same moniker, Messrs. Kelly and Grabowsky are each regarded as the poet laureate in their chosen field - Kelly is counted amongst our most lauded wordsmiths while Grabowsky, our most noted note-smiths. Following a one-off performance at the bespoke arts space Ukaria in the Adelaide Hills, they concurred that this collaboration deserved further development. This performance will be feature works from their new album, taken mainly from Kelly's vast catalogue. Grabowsky, an astonishing musical polymath, draws from his extensive trove of musical knowledge, giving the original songs a fresh framework while never, never losing sight of Kelly's intent.

events.name: Choirboys - The Hits & 6-Pack Of Bruce Springsteen
events.summary: Running Times - Doors 7:30pm Start 8:00pm Finish 11:00pm *Please note all times are approximate & subject to change.

events.name: Made In The 90's
events.summary: Running Times: Doors: 5:30pm Start: 6:30pm Finish: 10:30pm *All times are approximate and subject to change. Heading the line up is Grammy Winners, Blackstreet ("No Diggity", "You Blow My Mind") in their first ever Australian & New Zealand shows featuring their incredible band, hitmakers Next ("Too Close", "Wifey"), Grammy Winners All-4-One ("I Swear", "I Can Love You Like That") in their first Aussie shows in a decade and for their first ever Kiwi shows, r&b singer and producer, Mario Winans ("I Don't Wanna Know") in his first ever shows on our shores and Renee Neufville, one half of the dynamic Zhané ("Hey Mr. DJ"). The line up is rounded out by local r&b legends, CDB ("Lets Groove", "Hook Me Up"). Hosting this spectacular trip down memory lane is none other than one of the voices of '90s R&B group 112, Q Parker. Fans can expect full sets from all acts and over 4 hours of live r&b magic. Made in the '90s is back and an absolute must for any lover of the old school.

events.name: Baby Animals + Killing Heidi
events.summary: Running Times: Doors: 7:00pm Start: 8:00pm Finish: 10:30pm *Please note, all times are approximate and subject to change. Baby Animals and Killing Heidi hit the road again for the 'Back 2 Back Tour 2020'. After the success of 2019's short 'Hits' tour both bands have been inundated with requests for a continuation of what was one of the biggest Rock events of 2019. From 'Early Warning' to 'Weir'. 'Rush You' to 'Mascara'; fans will be treated to all the favourites, and then some !

events.name: Nitro Circus Live - YOU GOT THIS TOUR
events.summary: Running Times: VIP Entry - 3:00pm General Doors - 4:00pm Showtime - 5:00pm All times are approximate and subject to change. Please note: The stunts performed in Nitro Circus Live are amongst the most dangerous in the world. When athletes are attempting insane stunts 40 feet in the air over a 75 foot gap, the weather conditions have to be perfect as the onset of rain, dew, wind or other factors could be fatal. That's why we are reserving one or more additional days (Sunday 28th February or Monday 1st March 2021 ) as possible alternative show dates in case we need to reschedule. When you buy your ticket, please make sure that you are available on the reserve days too in case we have to use them for a rescheduled show. If we do, there are no refunds.

events.name: Newcastle Knights v Penrith Panthers
events.summary: The 2020 NRL season will be impacted by the Government's directive that we suspend attendance by the general public at matches in Round 2 and until further notice. The NRL is working closely with clubs, states and the game's partners to address issues associated with the closure of matches to members and fans of the game (and other scenarios that may present). NRL Telstra Premiership games will be temporarily held from sale until further notice. We will provide our valued members and fans with updates as information about our approach comes to hand via NRL, club and state channels. Now, as much as ever, we value your constant support and understanding. Rugby league is known for its resilience and we know we will work through this together.

events.name: NSW Waratahs v Rebels
events.summary: Sydney's northern beaches turned it on in 2019, packing the hills of Brookvale Oval to support their Tahs and we want to fill 'Brookie' again this season! The second of three consecutive derbies at home, we'll take on a Melbourne Rebels side featuring the likes of Isi Naisarani, Marika Koroibete and Reece Hodge. Come and enjoy Super Rugby in the suburbs as we look to continue our winning ways against the Rebels! Run Times: 4:30pm - Gates open 7:15pm - Kick-off 9:00pm - Finish (approx.) *Please note times are approximate and subject to change. Concession applies Full-time Students, Pensioners and Seniors with valid ID. A Family Ticket consists of 2 Adults and 2 Juniors 4-16 Years.
